hasVariant.description: Buy the New Balance FuelCell Rebel v4 Running Shoe - Men's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: FuelCell Rebel v4 Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
One of the best daily trainers of 2024 which is better suited for some uptempo running. The midsole is plush and yet super responsive. 
The upper wasn’t my fav. When wearing quarter length socks, the shoes cut into my achilles. 
The shoes is roomy but short, hence had to size up half a size. One major complaint I have on the life of the midsole, I had to replace the shoe at 550kms as the foam started to bottom out for runs less than an hour.
review.name: Brilliant Daily Trainers!

review.itemreviewed: FuelCell Rebel v4 Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: The most comfortable and lightest shoe I have worn. the fit and wide toe box are perfect! please don't change these. these are excellent for walking or going for an easy jog. this shoe can do it all! I officially made new balance my new brand for all my running shoes!
review.name: better than a lot of nike shoes I tried

review.itemreviewed: FuelCell Rebel v4 Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: So light weight and comfortable. My husband loves them.
review.name: Great shoes

review.itemreviewed: FuelCell Rebel v4 Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: These New Balance shoes are really good!  They’re light, bouncy, and generally feel good to run in.  I would race in them but Nike has my racing shoes.
review.name: Running in shoes

review.itemreviewed: FuelCell Rebel v4 Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: One of the better running shoes I’ve used. Very fun and responsive.
review.name: Fun shoe

review.itemreviewed: FuelCell Rebel v4 Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Not even close to true sizing! Ordered a U.S. men’s 12.  True size is about 11 or 11.5 at best.  I have other New Balance models in a 12 & they fit perfectly.
review.name: Sizing not good

review.itemreviewed: FuelCell Rebel v4 Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Love this trainer, can really do it all. Enough cushion for daily mileage and light and responsive enough for some tempo work. Feel nice and wide but run small heel to toe.
review.name: Does it all

review.itemreviewed: FuelCell Rebel v4 Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: The show is comfortable for the long walks that I have taken in them. I haven’t used them to run, though that is what they are made for. I do know they would be a very good running shoe.
review.name: Great shoe for more than just running

review.itemreviewed: FuelCell Rebel v4 Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Extremely comfortable. Light and breathable. Soft, squishy under foot. And enjoyably bouncy. For the price point, this shoe is phenomenal.
review.name: Phenomenal Shoe

review.itemreviewed: FuelCell Rebel v4 Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: A colleague recommended these as I fancied trying another brand. I thought out of the box they felt like really poor quality almost like a cheap replica, tried them on and they were way too small. I’m size 10, ordered a 10 and I could barely get my feet into them whereas other brands are never a problem. Usually wear Saucony, Nike or Salomon. These are the poorest trainers I’ve tried on and also the most expensive.
review.name: Thought I’d try a different brand..
comment: Thank you for your honesty. We value your feedback. Our FuelCell Rebel v4 can dress a little tight as they are designed to deliver speed and responsiveness. Let's find you the right size. Please get in touch with our customer care for assistance. We are here to help!"

name: FuelCell Rebel v4 Running Shoe - Men's

hasVariant.name: Ski Skin Tail Kit
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Ski Skin Tail Kit online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Good thing these are easy to replace because they break every season. The plastic cracks where the clip goes through. Need to come up with a better design/material
review.name: Ski Skin Tail Kit

review.reviewBody: Excellent service and prompt. Kept this pinhead in business to drop a knee! Peter.
review.name: Tail kit

review.reviewBody: I bought these to replace the failed tail clip on my years-old BD Ascensions. Quality is on par with the OEM clips and easy enough to install. The rivets have less-than-stellar reviews, however I've used "normal" rivets to put these on and have never had a problem. What else to say? They're better and cheaper than buying new skins or not having clips!
review.name: Better than buying new skins!

review.reviewBody: Super straightforward and easy to install, this kit really saved my skins!
review.name: This kit to the rescue!

review.reviewBody: Good replacement for my old tails, which cracked and tore after 11+ seasons. Same exact fit, which made it easy to replace!
review.name: Good replacement for my old

review.reviewBody: This kit does require some tools to fit but with a drill and a hammer it is an easy job that works perfectly.
review.name: Perfect replacement for the original tail pieces

review.reviewBody: Worked perfectly to repair my broken skin tail. Workable again!
review.name: Great replacement

review.reviewBody: Had a tail rip on my BD skins after a couple seasons. I bought this kit thinking I needed to re-set my tail with the rivets etc. It was not too hard to just slip the tail piece out and replace it. Now I have some parts for the trail.
review.name: Just needed the tails...but got the whole kit.

review.reviewBody: This kit upgraded my skins that had an inferior system for securing the skin to the ski. These are the best!
review.name: skin tail kit

review.reviewBody: These are easy to install. Come with pretty clear directions.
review.name: Everything you need

name: Ski Skin Tail Kit

Buy the SUGOi Evolution Zap Short - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Evolution Zap Short - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the SUGOi Evolution Zap Short - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I just completed a 17 mile bike ride today wearing these shorts. I am glad I did a short ride because these shorts are nothing like my previous Sugoi shorts. The chamois padding is horrible. My older pair is my go to pair for several years now, they are extremely comfortable during the 40 to 50 mile rides I do with my club every weekend . The new Sugoi chamois is  a cheap looking piece with flimsy padding. After the ride I felt like I rode with bike shorts with no padding. I am disappointed to say the least , Especially for shorts that cost over 100 dollars. Sugoi products in the past were of high quality. However, now I will look for another brand .   I would agree with a previous reviewer these shorts are nothing like they used to be
review.name: Disappointing - not like they used to be

review.reviewBody: Good shorts
review.name: D

review.reviewBody:
The fit on these is fine, and the fabric seems decent quality.

What I am a bit disappointed with is the Chamois. 

I have two older (8-9 year old) Sugoi shorts with the "RC Pro" chamois. They are fantastic, and the main reason I bought these shorts. Unfortunately, this chamois in no way resembles the older version and IMO is rather inferior to it. They should have spent more energy on making the chamois work well, and less on sticking stupid looking graphics all over it.

The Chamois is "OK", about on par with shorts running about $50 less. Below par for a $120 pair. Unfortunately, I don't think you can return these after you ride in them.
review.name: "RC Pro" does not mean what it used to.

review.reviewBody: This is probably my 6 or 7th attempt at obtaining well made and comfortable bike shorts for long rides. Did an 80 miler followed by a 30 miler the next day.. These shorts did not disappoint. They were comfortable throughout my back-to-back ride days with out a fault. I would HIGHLY recommend these and plan on getting another in the not too distant future.
review.name: Comfortable!

name: Evolution Zap Short - Men's
Evolution Zap Short - Men's

review.reviewBody: Avid hiker, backpacker and lover of all things outdoors. I have been using these pants for the last 5 years and have recently replaced ever pair I had before with these. True fit, comfortable, water repellent and very functional.
review.name: Best pants in the market

review.reviewBody: My wife got me a pair of these to try and I absolutely love them. They are stretchy, fit true to size and versatile. You can wear them for work, casual or even dress them up with a collared shirt. I have gotten 4 more pairs since. Definitely worth every dollar.
review.name: LOVE!

review.reviewBody: These are my go-to pants for backpacking and general travel. They look great, handle moisture very well and most importantly they do it day after day without being washed. Okay, they also look good when I wash them regularly. Great pants! Highly recommended.
review.name: Great Pants!

review.reviewBody:
I got a pair of these for my dad a few birthdays ago, every year since he has asked for a new pair for Christmas and birthdays. He absolutely loves them, and they are his go-to for anything under the sun. The true testament of a product is if it's dad approved or not, mine definitely approves. 🤙

#BackcountryGearhead
review.name: The gift that keeps on giving

review.reviewBody:
I love the Brion pants!  They look great on or off the trail. Cool enough to wear all summer long and stylish enough to wear out to dinner.  I wear these for everything from climbing, hiking to heading out to the bars after a long day outdoors.

They offer lots of freedom of movement so there's no fabric restriction when I'm hiking or throwing my leg up high for a heel hook. Just a great all around pant. And if I want some demin, the prAna Bridger Jean is an awesome choice.
review.name: My favorite non-demin pants

name: Brion Pant - Men's

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 Wide Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Began jogging before any such shoes were on the market... gradually then tried many brands.... now I am jogging-running-walking (repeat) on desert trails of sand and rock and cactus. These shoes hold up under demanding conditions and support my life-long effort as a casual but persistent exercise freak. I do highly recommend them.
review.name: Jogging Since 1971

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 Wide Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I have trouble finding shoes, because my foot is both wide and tall given the length of my foot. These shoes are one of the few that fit well.

I used a prior pair as my approach shoe; very durable as well.
review.name: a great shoe for wide feet

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 Wide Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I bought the 8.5 wide-fit gore-tex model online.  However my wide feet have 4E width and the shoes were still too narrow for me.  I also noticed that the new shoes were very very stiff, I am not sure if these would 'soften' with more use.  
I went to a store to try bigger sizes, wide-fit sizes 9 and 9.5 were still too narrow for my feet.  
I had to return the shoes.  These wide-fit shoes may be more appropriate for those with 2E width feet.
review.name: wide-fit looks like 2E width only
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 Wide Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Over the last few years these have been great trail runners that I have used on my thru hikes of the AT, BMT, the Pinhoti Trail, and the Colorado Trail. I just restocked 3 more pairs for doing a thru hike of the Continental Divide Trail in 2025. I love them, but have to use the wide model.
review.name: Great Long Last Thru Hiking Trail Runner

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 Wide Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Being using the XA pro wide for many years. Comfy, good toe box. Easy lacing system.
review.name: Good hiking shoe

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 Wide Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Purchased two of these (from REI) for trail running on challenging hills and while they has excellent traction and heel support on mud and loose gravel, my toes got sore after running 4 miles. I loosened them as wide as possible but didn’t help. Especially on downhills. So now I only use them for hiking. And I still get sore feet. Hope you fix it.
review.name: Toe Box Too Narrow
comment: Hi, thank you for sharing your experience with us. We always strive to improve! Your feedback has been helpful for us!

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 Wide Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I ordered the same shoe to replace my worn out one.  I ordered a Wide shoe just like my previous Salomon shoe.  This shoe did not seem wide as both shoes caused painful pressure on both big toes, to the point I can't wear it.  I reverted back to the old worn shoes and there was no problem.  The new shoes should NOT have been classified as Wide.  Not happy at all.
review.name: Wide NOT Wide
comment: Hello, I appreciate you sharing your feedback with us. We constantly work to get better! Please keep in mind that your suggestions are being taken into consideration!

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 Wide Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: These shoes used to be better made. They are not of the same quality as the last two pairs I purchased.
review.name: Quality has gone downhill

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 Wide Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Backpacked over 30 miles in Yosemite, from Cloud Rest to Half Dome.  An excellent shoe.  I ordered one size larger for my foot to swell during hiking.  No foot pain or blisters.  Shoes felt great!
review.name: Excellent shoe for backpacking in Yosemite

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 Wide Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of XA Pro 3D wide and they are great. I have had orthotics for 20 years and when I wear my XA Pro's I do not need them!
review.name: Fantastic fit

name: XA Pro 3D V9 Wide Trail Running Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: This is a great sealant that is effective and easy to use.
review.name: Orange Seal is great Sealant!

review.reviewBody: I ride my enduro and XC bikes on asphalt/trails and this stuff works great for sealing my tires, sealing thorn punctures and nail punctures so far. I really didn’t believe this stuff would work so well, but after a few thorns and a nail I was convinced. It
review.name: Great Sealant for thorns and nails!

review.reviewBody: I have used this sealant in three mountain bikes with different tires.  It has worked well in <32F and >100F temperatures.  It does tend to last a little longer than traditional sealants such as Stans.
review.name: Expensive but Lasts a Little Longer

review.reviewBody: Highly recommend this sealant on all types of tubeless tires. I've use it for road, gravel, and mtb tires set up tubeless and have no complaints
review.name: Go-to Sealant

review.reviewBody: I have had two cuts in tires that it did not seal. One was small enough I think it should have sealed it. I ended up putting a tube in to continue the ride. The other one I put in bacon strips and I was barely able to ride out. It didn't seal up very well. I recently had a small hole that it did seal. I didn't even know I had gotten a puncture until I looked at my tire after the ride. I have also heard that this sealant won't cause corrosion of your spokes/nipple area like Stan's does. Well, I recently had to replace spokes on a one year old wheel and there was corrosion on the nipple area. I have only used Orange Seal in that wheel. I imagine all sealants cause this corrosion.
review.name: It mostly works

name: Endurance Tubeless Sealant

review.itemreviewed: Genetix Plus 2 Wide Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I really wanted these shoes to work as they're pretty decent value, especially on sale. I was willing to accept their elderly orthopedic appearance in exchange for a wide MTB SPD platform that didn't require spending $300, but they run small and are indistinguishable from a "normal" width in the toe box. I do like the fact they're reasonably stiff, but that's about where it ends. I used NW's sizing recs, which shows a 45 for a US 12.

review.itemreviewed: Stretch Zion Slim Pant II - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought a pair of size 32/30 pants online, impressed by their look and quality. Although the waist fits well, the thighs are narrower than I expected. My thighs measure 60cm in circumference, making the pants tighter in this area than is comfortable for me. This may not be a concern for all, but for those with muscular or larger thighs, it's worth considering before you buy.
review.name: Larger Thighs? Consider the Thigh Fit

review.itemreviewed: Stretch Zion Slim Pant II - Men's
review.reviewBody: These are by far the most comfortable pants I’ve worn. I love them for every day wear; however, I cannot recommend them for hiking. The “sturdiness” of the pants is not there. They snag way too easily to be considered a top tier hiking pant, which is a shame.
review.name: Not for tough trails

review.itemreviewed: Stretch Zion Slim Pant II - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Used to be a big fan of the zion, but it was a bit baggy, so decided to try the new zion "slim".

This should be called "skinny", since it's very tight, and uncomfortable.

The new integrated belt is plastic, has a piece of fabric which extends it out (I don't know why) such that it feels like it will break everytime I try to buttno or unbutton it.
review.name: too skinny, poor belt

review.itemreviewed: Stretch Zion Slim Pant II - Men's
review.reviewBody: Not the lightest, and they don't pack down super small, but these pants worked well for a 335 mile, 4 day bike packing trip where I needed something other than my riding bibs for camp. Love the fit. Size is accurate. Would also be great for hiking or other outdoor adventures. Would get again!
review.name: Casual Wear Pants while Bikepacking!

review.itemreviewed: Stretch Zion Slim Pant II - Men's
review.reviewBody:
They look like great pants, except the legs are pretty narrow. The waist and inseam are fine, but when I put them on, they are tight around my thighs and calves. I can bend my leg, but I can feel resistance when I do this as the fabric stretches. I bought these for winter hiking/backpacking/climbing, and thus would be wearing a base-layer underneath - which would only make the problem worse. The extra resistance to bending one's knee means they are useless for climbing or any sort of distance-walking, and can not be used with a base-layer. I can only imagine these pants were designed for folks with really skinny thighs & calves, which one would expect would not be many climbers/backpackers. The pants thus should either carry a 'narrow leg' warning, and/or not pop up when one filters for hiking/backpacking/climbing pants. Otherwise, the pants look great - if the legs fit my thighs & calves with space for a baselayer, without any tightness or resistance to leg-bend, these would probably be great.

I will be returning these pants immediately.
review.name: Legs are too narrow

review.itemreviewed: Stretch Zion Slim Pant II - Men's
review.reviewBody: I just got these but I love the fit and the feel of the material. Most others I have tried are too baggy.
review.name: Great slim fit

review.itemreviewed: Stretch Zion Slim Pant II - Men's
review.reviewBody: Love Prana and love these pants but product came damaged and backcountry is terrible and makes me pay for return shipping.
review.name: Product came damaged

review.itemreviewed: Stretch Zion Slim Pant II - Men's
Stretch Zion Slim Pant II - Men's
review.reviewBody: I find that "slim fit" pants are bit tight.  I'm a rather thin guy so I bought the "slim fit".  I should have bought the regular fit.  My only other complaint is that the belt is a friction type belt.  Over time the belt tends to loosen, especially when the pants are  bit old.  When I am hiking, I have to tighten the belt serval times during the day.
review.name: Slim fit is a bit  tight.

review.itemreviewed: Stretch Zion Slim Pant II - Men's
review.reviewBody: I guess my legs are stockier than I thought, because these pants fit comfortably trim; which IMO makes them ideal for indoor and outdoor climbing.  Contrary to other reviews, I have had no problem with the waist sizing and there's no bunching in the crotch area.  The Stretch Zion fabric is durable but not indestructible, which is acceptable to me.  I took a medium length cheesegrater slide down some Utah sandstone with my wallet in my back pocket, and the fabric shredded; but I think that would have happened with anything less than some Mountain Khakis or Carhart Canvas pants.  I will buy more of this model, for sure.
review.name: Excellent Climbing Pants

name: Stretch Zion Slim Pant II - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I recently purchased a pair of your arm and knee warmers. I I’m happy with the quality, and their warmth on a 45° morning ride. This past week, the first time I wore the arm warmers I noticed an issue. The rubber strap at the top to secure to the skin head melted in a way? The product seems like it did not go through the proper process of rubberizing the material. It stuck all to my arms. I’ve had no problems with the knee warmers though. They have the same band, but it is highly glossy material that is actually adherent to the skin, but not sticky.

11 days ago, I emailed Garneau in regard to an issue with a product that I purchased. I was emailed back saying I’d receive a response within two business days. Here we are nine business days later, and I have not received any response in regard to my issue. This is disheartening, and makes me question the integrity of this company. I will never buy a Garneau product ever again. Period, full stop.
review.name: Horrible product, worse customer serivce
comment: We are bummed to hear about your gear issue, and the bad experience with the company Garneau,  We at Backcountry are happy to help out with your return for these, and have emailed you more information.

review.reviewBody: The majority of the material feels soft and comfortable, but the elastic upper felt abrasive and itchy. Additionally, the length felt a little short.
review.name: Itchy material

name: Arm Warmers 2

review.reviewBody:
Surprisingly capable for a flat lasted climbing shoe. I’ve been climbing for almost 3 years now and use this as my comfy indoor training shoe and  for outdoor climbing. I went half size down from my street/running shoe size, I would even consider going a full size down to fill out all the dead space if I needed to stand on micro crystals.

Overall Im very pleased with my purchase, and will miss Five Ten’s presence in the climbing world as their alpine department slowly phases out.

hasVariant.name: Brodeo Beanie - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Patagonia Brodeo Beanie - Men's online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: You guys list it somewhere in DHL limbo and I niece got the beanie.
review.name: Never got the order

review.reviewBody: Great hat!  Nice fit for my 7 1/4 bald head, and I really like the look of the ribbed cuff with a smooth crown. I want wool hats not acrylic, and this one feels nice. The armadillo patch was pretty amusing and I was surprised that I liked it as much as I did. The problem for me is that the red hat online hat looked pink in person. The search for a nice, heathered red wool hat continues!
review.name: Good fit; Touring Red = Hot Pink

review.reviewBody: I dont get it.  I have kind of a big head, and I find this hat to be super comfortable and warm.  My wife has a small head and hers fits fine too.  It’s somewhat thicker than then Smartwool brand. It’s not going to fit under a helmet but it’s super warm.  Well made.
review.name: Fits ok to me

review.reviewBody: Horrible beenie - sizing is way off.  I had high hopes for this beenie but it was way too small and gave horrible static cling.  I’m going to stick with Smartwool hats as they fit perfect and no static cling.  The only thing I liked about the Patagonia beenie was the color.
review.name: So disappointed in Patagonia beenie

review.reviewBody: Way to small.  I gave it to my 10 year old and it was a tight fit on his head. Nice looking hat though.
review.name: Small, like extremely small.

review.reviewBody:
My wife got the Green version last year. It's by far the cutest beanie she owns; and she owns quite a few!
So I took the plunge and got one myself, Navy with the FitzRoy Scope logo.  
Alas, as the other poster also experienced, it was just too small for my 7 3/8 head.  It would not come down over my ears unless I folded the cuff over.  If I did that, I looked like a doofus.
If you are a lady, I encourage you to consider this cutie-pie; but if you are a guy, unless you have a small head, you might be disappointed.
review.name: Too small for my noggin

review.reviewBody: This hat runs quite small. The quality is excellent - exactly what you’d expect - and it seems like it would keep you nice and warm. The cuff is permanent, meaning you can’t unroll it to fit without the seam showing. So, if you have a large (or even a normal sized head), I’d go with something else.
review.name: Nice Hat, but VERY SMALL

name: Brodeo Beanie - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Loose Fit HW Flannel Long-Sleeve Plaid Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Bought as gifts...warm heavy weight. They loved hhem.

review.itemreviewed: Loose Fit HW Flannel Long-Sleeve Plaid Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Purchased for my son for Christmas, he loves it and it looks great on him!
review.name: Looking good

review.itemreviewed: Loose Fit HW Flannel Long-Sleeve Plaid Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Bought this as a gift for my dad and he's worn it every day since receiving it. Will definitely be buying more colors. The fit and weight are perfect.
review.name: Great gift

review.itemreviewed: Loose Fit HW Flannel Long-Sleeve Plaid Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Love the fit and thickness but it looked NOTHING LIKE THIS! It was not the color I picked but luckily my hubby still liked it?(though I am not a fan!)
review.name: Thick and strong

review.itemreviewed: Loose Fit HW Flannel Long-Sleeve Plaid Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: My hard to please grandson was delighted with his shirts that he received for Christmas.  I would reorder again.

review.itemreviewed: Loose Fit HW Flannel Long-Sleeve Plaid Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is absolutely the BEST flannel shirt available! My husband wears a tee under this flannel shirt, so appreciates the loose fit. I appreciate that it doesn't shrink when washed/dried. The heavyweight material keeps him warm; and I expect it will last for years. He has been wearing the 2 shirts that I bought him every day! So, I just ordered 2 more. My only complaint is that the patterns were limited in his size. (They are popular with many others, it seems!) Please restock soon!
review.name: Heavyweight, Loose Fit, Flannel Shirt

review.itemreviewed: Loose Fit HW Flannel Long-Sleeve Plaid Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Nicely done muted plaid. Generous in size. Nice quality material. Well constructed.
review.name: Would buy again

review.itemreviewed: Loose Fit HW Flannel Long-Sleeve Plaid Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Good quality fabric.  Extremely long shirt. This could not be worn buttoned up and untucked or as a jacket over a tee. Wish it had been 3-4" shorter.
review.name: Too long

review.itemreviewed: Loose Fit HW Flannel Long-Sleeve Plaid Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Bought it guy or my husband who is a picky shopper. He loves it. Great quality. Nice colors.
review.name: Great gift

review.itemreviewed: Loose Fit HW Flannel Long-Sleeve Plaid Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody:
These Carhart heavy weight flannel are the finest quality of materials and the best fitting shirts that i have found, they are really well made and the buttons are well secured all seems are matched and all sewing is quality, i love the shoice of colors being a louse fitting shirt there is no binding of your arms it's just a real comfort to wear.
Now these shirts run large i normaly get a large in this shirt a meium was what fit.
review.name: Great Shirts

name: Loose Fit HW Flannel Long-Sleeve Plaid Shirt - Men's

review.reviewBody: Very first use on the hill - both gloves ripped! The leather is so soft and feels very cheap. Extremely disappointed as I thought Hestra produced quality products. Regret not buying Burton gloves which I had previously and lasted for years. Would not recommend to anyone.
review.name: Leather ripped on first wear!

review.reviewBody: Love the Hestra gloves and mittens! They are super comfortable and durable as well. When looking at the sizing, I would go with about 1/8 - 1/4 inch larger size than your actual hand size to allow some room for circulation and comfort.
review.name: Can't go wrong

review.reviewBody: I bought these for my husband (but I have my own Hestra's).  His Hestra's from 06ish are finally starting to wear out.  They have outlasted numerous other gloves.  Hestra's are worth the extra money due to how long they last (make sure to condition them as needed).  They are also move with your hands motions without any resistance or bunching.
review.name: Long lasting gloves/mittens

name: Freeride CZone 3-Finger Glove

review.reviewBody: Quality has gone down. The originals has a gusset crotch and the ankle drawstring in the front which worked better. Pant material is not as nice. They’re much baggier and bigger. description: Buy the Osprey Packs Archeon 30L Backpack online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Archeon 30L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Osprey Packs Archeon 30L Backpack online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Been an Osprey fans for years. My previous favorite work backpack was the Osprey Tropos. Wanted something with slightly more space and saw this new bag Archeon. The 30L is perfect size. My Tropos was 27L.

Love this backpack! Was not sure if I would like the full main opening but much easier access. I noticed the main opening zippers are somewhat harder to pull, water resistance functionality, but find them very usable. Love the side pockets. Did not think I would. The shell is thick but light. Not been caught in a rain but know this pack will perform well in a wet environment.

Also purchased the Osprey Archeon 16-Inch Laptop Case. Holds my 13” iPad and 15” Air easily. This case then can fit in the 30L. Great for working where I can leave the 30L in hotel/car and use the Archeon laptop case. Perfect pair.

Highly recommend and love the Scenic Valley (green) color.
review.name: My new favorite!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Works fairly well as work pack. Although the zippered pocket on the bottom of the inside compartment can be a pain to use if the computer and tablet sleeves are full. Used it on a five day trip to Colombia and it held everything, just. I'd bump up to a bigger size for anything seven days or longer.
review.name: Works fairly well as work

review.reviewBody: I use this bag as my primary travel carry on. It's a perfect size for international travel and keeps everything organized well. Construction seems to be top notch.
review.name: Great bag!

review.reviewBody: This bag has been bomber so far. The open space in the main compartment along with the few organization pockets has been great to use as of late. The material and zippers have done a good job keeping water out as well, even while walking around during a prolonged rainstorm in Colorado. I've owned my fair share of Osprey bags and as far as day-to-day use goes, this is definitely top tier in my eyes.
review.name: Great Bag

name: Archeon 30L Backpack
Archeon 30L Backpack

review.reviewBody: Great wading sock. Improved version with a left and right pair. Very comfortable and great fit.  I wear these with my Simms Free Salt Boot. They add extra cushion and comfort when your wading 6 miles a day.
review.name: Great Wading Sock

review.reviewBody: I bought these for use with Simms Men’s Flats Sneakers. They did not work well with them for me. The seams are too thick for this saltwater boot. I sent these wading socks back. Another problem that I had is that gravel and sand can get into the boots because there is no gravel guard. I ended going with Simms Men’s Guide Wet Wading Socks which are thinner and did not have thick seams. They worked well for me.
review.name: Not a Fan of These

review.reviewBody: These socks fit perfectly into my light weight wading boots and contributed to a great day wading for trout in the Gallatin River.
review.name: Great wading socks!

review.reviewBody: Fit great very comfortable keep my wading boots from rubbing blisters on my feet on long wades.
review.name: These are not my first pair of Simms wading socks. I have worn out three pairs before I purchased this pair.

description: Buy the Fjallraven Singi Down Jacket - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Singi Down Jacket - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Fjallraven Singi Down Jacket - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
First - I will say this coat is AWESOME! I wanted to finally invest in a hardy quality winter coat and this one fit the bill. This is the warmest and nicest coat I've ever owned. I was tired of the trendy lightweight down coats that don't actually keep you as warm as you'd like. There is a kind of pleasure that comes from wearing and enjoying a finely crafted article of clothing and this jacket gives just that. It feels exceptionally cozy and of high quality.

Second, I will say that this coat is BIG. I really do not understand Fjallraven's sizing recommendations. For reference, I am male, 6' and 160lbs with an athletic (I would like to say) build. I find it a little frustrating to read reviews and feedback about sizing but most people do not put their body size in the review for comparison. If I had followed Fjallraven's sizing guide, I should have ordered a medium. I was torn about which size to order and found it hard to gauge based on reviews, so I ordered a Small and Medium with the intent to return whichever one I didn't want. I will definitely be sticking with the small. The small itself almost feels a tad oversized but I think it will do okay. The medium just feels comically big on me. Even with wearing a shirt and lightweight sweater underneath, I am quite comfortable and still have full range of motion in the small.

As far as warmth and comfort, this thing feels so comfortable. I am impressed with the amount of down and insulation in this thing. I live in the midwest USA and our winters get down to 18-20F on an average cold winter day, usually with several days dipping into the single digits or lower. I walk my dog every morning and enjoy winter hiking and I feel confident and prepared for the coming winter now. So far we have not hit a very very cold day but I did try it out in a morning just above freezing. I wore only a T-shirt underneath while walking my dog and did not overheat in it as others stated - I felt quite comfortable. Part of me wonders if this means I would be a little cold in just the jacket on the really really cold days, but I think it is reasonable to still require a warm base layer or thin sweater underneath to stay warm enough. I feel confident this will be the case. 

The hood is impressive - big and warm and well insulated and fits snugly enough when pulled over your head and the fuzzy lining feels functional enough to keep out wind, not just a fashion statement. 

The drawstrings add a nice touch and work well, helping you to show off your lean figure still in a thick coat as you cinch it up around your waist. This helps trap warm air inside and I noticed it also takes a bit of the weight of the coat off your upper body and puts it onto your hips - kind of like the hip straps of a backpack. 

The zipper is not really as big of a problem as some have complained. It is a bit funny because it is on the opposite side as most zippers for men in the US. Maybe this is a Swedish thing? I'm sure I will get used to it. 

Overall, I would say: Stylish, cozy, WARM, quality. It brings me joy and confidence knowing I am well prepared for the coming winter.
review.name: Perfect coat for me, just what I had hoped for.

review.reviewBody:
I have now become a fan of Fjallraven parkas. I like their casual/outdoorsy design over more formal/urban designs (CG, MK, etc.). I like the numerous pockets of which some are quite spacious. This is a big plus for me over other brands (like CG and MK). Price-wise Fjallraven falls in the middle: they are not the cheapest in the market yet they are less expensive than the so called 'prestigious'  brands like CG, MK, N, M, etc.. I find Fjallraven to be as good as any of the them in regards to product quality. The G1000 shell feels very tough and durable. The lining feels good too though I like the lining of Singi Wool better as it feels more organic. Why doesn't Fjallraven use the same lining in Singi Down is puzzle-some to me.
 There are a few caveats though. After getting a Singi Wool in small size which was a perfect fit for me, I bought the Singi Down in small size too . It turned out to be too small for me. It felt particularly tight around my hip. I am 72kg, 178cm tall. Moreover, I got it in Dark Navy color. Strangely, the shell had a green hue to it! It wasn't a deal breaker but I certainly preferred a neutral navy tone. I could not return the jacket so sold it online. Since I liked the jacket, I was looking to get one in medium size. Recently, there was a sale on Fjakraven products in a local store at %50 discount. These were apparently sample units or new units with some defects. Look and behold, I saw a Singi Down (sample unit) in large size (the only available one). I tried it and while it was a bit loose and bulky on me, it was certainly acceptable and the sleeves were the right length. Strangely, the jacket was in a beautiful blue tone (indigo?) that is not available online. The color was like dream come true! So I am again a Singi Down owner. Not sure why this color isn't available online for sale. Perhaps, they are planning to introduce the color in the future or is perhaps this is a discontinued color.
review.name: My favorate design

review.reviewBody: Feels warm and strong but why not to put a bit more thoughts into designing pockets. I cannot imagine that anyone would be against middle pockets to warm hands when not wearing gloves. same the bottom pockets
review.name: pockets not well designed

review.reviewBody:
I think I can best summarize my opinion of this coat in that it makes me want to go outside in blizzards. 
This thing is sooo warm and well designed for practical use; I spend a huge amount of time standing outside for hours in the winter and this is the perfect tool for the job. Not only is it warm, but its also very durable. The external fabric is tough! I have no concerns about it every ripping which is a huge peace of mind, I think the thick fabric also helps protect from wind which is really nice when its blustery. The pockets are very generous and perfect for stashing gloves or other moderate sizes items if needed. I find myself rarely needing the hood but when I do its oversized and very helpful in protecting against flakes or wind. The only thing that I dont absolutely love about this thing is the zipper for some reason its a bit hard to line up, and there is a bit of a learning curve, its funny, every winter it takes me a couple tries when first using the coat to get the feel for it, but after that I have no issus; on the other hand, the zipper is very durable so its not like I'm concerned about it failing, more that it just takes a bit of a specific 'touch' to get it to line up. Overall I would highly reccomend this, it will last for years (mine has so far, and I expect it will for many more) its also a lot more affordable than other premium parkas, but I think this one is actually warmer and more practical in many ways than its competitors.
review.name: 3 Years going strong.

review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket back in October and had to patiently wait for winter here in Alberta Canada. Currently our temperatures have been ranging from -35 c to -45 without windchill. During this current cold spell i can say without a doubt i am very happy with this jacket. The sizing chart said to get a Medium as I am a 5 ft 8 in male with a athletic build. I heard from many reviews to size down which i did. I do not find the fit too tight or restrictive but I would have enough room to layer up if i chose to. The quality of this jacket feels great and the g1000 fabric feels tough and rugged to last many many years. I get many compliments on how nice the jacket looks which wasn't my intended goal but i do feel like a true Swedish person when I wear this gear. I love love love this coat. To finish writing i have seen reviews stating how annoying the zipper is. My first few attempts were problematic, but once i attempted a few times I understand how to zipper is everytime without struggle. Just pay attention to how you zip up the jacket.
review.name: Finally warm and stylish in Winter.

review.reviewBody:
Highly recommend this jacket! I bought it for a winter trip to the Swedish Lapland (Abisko and Kiruna). It got down to 0F or so (-17C). This jacket is an absolute beast! Couple the jacket with the Fjallraven thin wool top and a light sweater and you'll be super warm. The tour guides all offered winter clothes to borrow and they had this same jacket! 

The pockets are plentiful and excellent. Big outside pockets for your hat and gloves and small zippered pockets for your phone/wallet. The fit is also top notch. Zipped up it looks great and I received many compliments from total strangers. I have the navy. 

I'll still give it five stars, but the zipper is 0/10. It's on the "wrong" (left) side for a men's jacket and assuming you are right-handed, it is extremely difficult to get started. You'll definitely need to have both gloves off and even then, it is very tough. 

One other thing to keep in mind: this is an extremely warm jacket. In 35F weather, you'll be roasting to death in just a t-shirt, even unzipped. This jacket is really designed for days when it's 25F or colder.
review.name: Super warm, looks great!

review.reviewBody: I love my Fjallraven Singi Down Jacket! I purchased this jacket in dark navy two years ago and to this day, it is my go-to jacket for really cold weather. I live in the north east of the U.S. so the temps can drop to sub-20 degrees (Fahrenheit), but this jacket and it’s ethically sourced down does an excellent job at keeping the warmth trapped inside. I must say that it’s roomy enough to layer up underneath and I actually had to size down to a small, when I normally take medium in everything I purchase. For reference, I am 5’-9”, 160 lbs, lean, athletic build. So keep in mind that sizing down may be necessary depending on your height and weight.
review.name: Best winter jacket that I own!

review.reviewBody:
I purchased this jacket this past winter and only had the opportunity to wear it a handful of times.  This jacket is incredibly warm.  I tend to run fairly warm and therefore, when I'm moving (hiking, snowshoeing etc.) this jacket can be too much warmth.  This by no means is a negative.  I didn't get this jacket for that purpose.  I purchased it for cold Canadian winters for many years to come when we're not hiking and there's less activity involved.  For that, it is absolutely wonderful.  When moving though, the double zipper is fantastic to be able to vent it from the top and bottom, but keep it together in the middle.  I've worn it in strong winds and blowing snow and this is when the wonderful hood shines.  The hood is a fantastic size and can be shaped to block out the driving sleet or snow but still provide visibility.  Absolutely love it!
The quality of the jacket really stands out.  The G-1000 material just feels like hard wearing, long lasting great quality.  The large chunky zippers and quality zipper pulls (which can be used with gloves and quality snaps really stand out.
The multiple pockets and the size of the pockets are fantastic! You can really carry a lot of gear in this jacket if you wanted to.  The flexibility of those pockets are fantastic.  Being a husband, father and dog owner, I tend to be the pack mule when we're outside in nature, so these pockets come in handy.  At any given time I could be carrying anything from hot pockets, to mobile devices, to dog leashes, to extra mitts and hats to insulated bottles with hot chocolate or coffee etc.  This jacket handles it all with ease.
Fit and Sizing.  I'm about 6'3" about 180lbs with long arms (long, lean athletic build).  I'm a 42" chest, about a 35" sleeve length and was very surprised and happy that the size medium actually fit me.  The large felt a bit too big in the body.  I can get a thick sweater on easily under the medium and arms on the jacket "just" fit.  I wished they were a touch longer, but I'm pleased with the length.  I tried on both and decided on the medium.  Hope this helps others on the sizing.
review.name: Quality Jacket Through and Through

review.reviewBody:
*2021 model
Used this for jacket for work in Yellowknife and in Nunavut for over the past year. Waxed the whole jacket - light under the arms and double over the shoulders and was comfortable when the wind picked up.
It's not as bulky as the Can Goose Jacket and better to layer. I was worried the fill wouldn't insulate enough, but it was fine with a wool sweater or down jacket under it. I was comfortable at -40c (actual temp) with a down layer under for 1 hr+ at low activity. Comfortable for walking multiple kms around -20c with just a base layer. 
It was too warm for higher activity warmer than -20c and I ended using it like a warm shell over an Expedition Pack Down Hoodie.

The zipper is a bit tough to get started.
review.name: Excellent in Low Arctic winter

review.reviewBody: This thing is a beast! I felt compelled to write a review because it is -37c here right now and I just took my dog out for a walk this morning wearing this jacket with only a t-shit under it and I was toasty warm the whole time! The construction is amazing, tough and classy. I see no need to ever buy another winter jacket because this will do it all from dog walks to sitting on a frozen lake ice fishing all day. I’m 5’10” 175lbs and I usually buy jackets in large because I like room for layering but on the advice of YouTube I bought this in a medium and it is a perfect fit. Not too bulky but plenty of room for layers.
review.name: The last winter jacket I will ever need.

name: Singi Down Jacket - Men's

description: Buy the Platypus HyFLO Bite Valve online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: HyFLO Bite Valve
hasVariant.description: Buy the Platypus HyFLO Bite Valve online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This has no instructions and is nothing like the old valves. Old valves coild just bite and drink. Am I supposed to make a first cut/slit to the valve to have it self-seal on first use? What if I cut it and it is wrecked. Why is there no way to just use it? This is not intuitive or it is a total defect.
review.name: No way to drink

review.reviewBody: Did not fit the bite valve I bought it for. Highly displeased with it as it was advertised especially to replace previous models with compatibility.
review.name: Did not fit the bite

review.reviewBody: Glad to get this exact replacement. I do a lot of hiking and finally wore-out the original.
review.name: Hydration Heaven

review.reviewBody: I ordered 2 of these valves; one to replace the one that cracked at the top of the lip and started leaking. It was a good thing I ordered the spare because the first one I put on was already cracked...in the same place, and was immediately leaking. Since this seems to be a consistent weak spot, maybe you should consider working on improving the design? So far, the "spare" is lasting OK. Maybe the design will be improved by the time it cracks:)
review.name: I ordered 2 of these

review.reviewBody: This valve allows excellent flow. When you are engaged in high intensity activities like Mountain Biking and trail running you need to get water quickly and easily. This bite valve fits the bill and generally doesn't need the shutoff valve to be closed in order to stop flow. It is also easy to clean.
review.name: This valve allows excellent flow.

review.reviewBody: These bite valves work well. Great flow and don't leak when they have not been chewed. I recommend buying extras if you have kids using them. My kids tend to break the seal easily so they leak. For the kids I use the Evo shut off valve and that has seemed to solve the leaking issues.
review.name: Good flow bite valves

review.reviewBody: I did not want the high flow bite valve, but I did want the bite valve cover which only fits the high flow bite valve. I use it and it's fine.
review.name: Quality Product

review.reviewBody: Got it right away. Works better than my old original valve and as promised. Fits tightly with no leaks.
review.name: Works great.

review.reviewBody: Glad to see a one piece design for the bite valve since I was tired of taking the old valve apart for deep cleaning. Good to see that this is also a bit cheaper. I've lost more of the old valves than have ever worn out and I'm glad that these replacements are more reasonably priced.
review.name: Good redesign of the classic Platypus valve

name: HyFLO Bite Valve

review.reviewBody: Charlie don’t surf! Nor do i for that matter, but I love this shirt, regardless. My favorite mid-weight wool shirt. I’m a thinner framed, 6’ tall middle aged man with longish limbs and a medium sized board shirt (or Pendleton trail shirt) fits me perfectly. These shirts feels like a warm hug, they must made from wool that was blessed by monks or by an extremely loving mother or grandmother, because they make me feel loved wearing them. I love them so mush that despite they’re $100+ dollar price tag, I still had to purchase several of them in varying colors /styles. If you like the pendleton board shirt, you will also like the pendleton trail shirt. You can generally find these new in the lower $100 range to just under $200. Happy shopping wool lovers.
review.name: Pendleton Board Shirt

review.reviewBody: I was expecting a beefier wool for the winter months. Also, I got the black shirt and it is almost "shiny" in how it looks.
review.name: Thinner and kinda shiny

review.reviewBody:
I gave this flannel as a gift, and here's what they had to say about it. 

The Pendleton Board Shirt flannel will make you feel the part, at least while you look at the waves. Also, it has a nice weight to wear under a shell on those teen to 30's temperature ski days. I like the squared off bottom and the extra style of the collar and top button loop. The Board shirt (and especially the surf color) is a "hang" 10.
review.name: Do you even surf, bro?

name: Board Shirt - Men's

review.reviewBody: Good cloth, nice feel, fit is fine. Buttons are placed to create a deeper neck cut than expected. If I wore a large gold chain that I wished to display or an ascot this would be perfection. Be aware before buying.
review.name: Very nice shirt but unexpected cut.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Excellent quality, keep making the product in other colors
review.name: Only the best

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My husband loves this shirt and this is the second one I have purchased.
review.name: Foodie

review.reviewBody:
If you liked the old Aerobora fabric (a little thicker/denser with a grid of small holes for ventilation) you will be sad if you buy the new Aerobora. The new fabric is a very thin, very stretchy ripstop. The old Aerobora held its shape and could be dressed up with a tie. The new Aerobora is limp and can’t support the weight of the collar.  The old Aerobora breathed.  The new, not so much (although it is super thin). 

The fit has changed. The old Aerobora had a little room to move around in. The new is much more form fitting (tight, even). 

The old Aerobora was the perfect shirt. Always looked crisp, could be packed for a trip and take you from casual lunch to dressy dinner.  The new can’t do either comfortably. Two thumbs down Marmot!
review.name: Changed for the worse.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very good shirt. It has texture. It’s true to size. Good fit
review.name: Dark blue

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a very nice shirt, but it’s not the same or as nice as the previous version. I owned this shirt before and I loved it so much I wanted another exactly like it, but the new version is very different. The color, the fabric type/texture and breathability as well as where the tags/logos are placed are totally different from the version I loved so much. The cut & fit is very similar which is nice. I’ll be interested to see how this new fabric holds up over time, travel and lots of temperatures.
review.name: Nice shirt, but not as nice as they used to be.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the short sleeve and the breathability of this material, but the long sleeve lacks the logo on the shoulder that adds some style.  Bring back the shoulder logo.
review.name: No shoulder logo.
comment:
Hello there

Thank you for providing us with a feedback on our products. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention. I am very sorry to hear that the item has not met your expectations. We will make sure to forward your idea and feedback to an appropriate department, so that we may think about an appropriate solution for the future. Thank you so much for sharing your opinion with us.

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via Contact Us | Marmot or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST

Thank You.
Marmot Team.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have an older Aerobora short sleeve shirt, which has the collar that someone fittingly described in a review as hearkening back to the 70's days of disco.  I decided to take a chance on the new model and am very glad I did - it feels great, looks really good, and I expect it will be a great traveling companion, in a quiet sort of way.
review.name: A great improvement over the previous version

name: Aerobora Long-Sleeve Shirt - Men's

description: Buy the Big Agnes Tiger Wall UL3 Bikepack Tent: 3-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Tiger Wall UL3 Bikepack Tent: 3-Person 3-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the Big Agnes Tiger Wall UL3 Bikepack Tent: 3-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I have to say, this is ALMOST a really cool tent. It's incredibly light, and the short pole length makes it really attractive from a back- or bike-packing standpoint -- those were the things that sold us originally. But it has a problem that isn't well-communicated by the photos or item description: It is not freestanding. The design requires a minimum of two stakes to be driven and separated by a taught seam to fully expand the foot of the tent. So camping on rocks, the usual forest service crusher-fines camping pads that are all over the midwest, even very dry earth are all really difficult. I carried it in the truck for a week of mellow car camping in the upper peninsula and wasn't able to deploy it once. 

Otherwise, it's spacious, attractive, and seems well-built. It just has a bummer of a tiny, but significant oversight in the design.
review.name: Lightweight, but fundamentally flawed.

name: Tiger Wall UL3 Bikepack Tent: 3-Person 3-Season
Tiger Wall UL3 Bikepack Tent: 3-Person 3-Season

hasVariant.description: Buy the Castelli Insider 2 Bib Short - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: 6'2", 33" waist, 42" chest, 168-180 pounds, and size guide recommends a Large. I went with XL and wouldn't go smaller without trying them on first- may be fine but the straps on previous bibs are a bit short for me so I erred larger rather than have them snug in the crotch. The chamois is comfortable but I did have an issue with a seam rubbing on my glute the first ride or two, no problems since and they have held up well. I wouldn't wear them in public, not even in the house in front of my adult children, but I am a bit more modest than average perhaps.
review.name: Comfy, not too revealing, breathable

name: Insider 2 Bib Short - Men's

review.reviewBody: This is an amazing shirt. Bought it for a Wilderness Remote First Responders course that was mostly outside. The perfect layering piece, the perfect amount of warmth under my jacket. Can also dress this shirt up.
review.name: My wool shirt is the bomb

review.reviewBody: Very itchy/scratchy on the skin. Definitely need to wear a long sleeved shirt under it. It’s too bad because I love the colours and the fit of the shirt itself.
review.name: Very itchy/scratchy on the skin

review.reviewBody: The fit is great. The colors are amazing. The material is so itchy inside, couldn’t wear without a long sleeve shirt underneath. Super disappointed in a wool shirt at this price. If it was heavier than I could wear as a jacket and not mind the prickly wool. But it’s way too thin. Thinner by far than most means wool shirts.
review.name: Itchy

review.reviewBody: I love this flannel button down so much, that I came back to buy another color. Fits true to size IMO.  So warm, and a very flattering fit. For someone who has a hard time finding clothes that she likes, once I find something I love I go back to buy all the colors before they go away. Super happy with this shirt.
review.name: Buy it, you won't regret it!

review.reviewBody: Loving my Canada shirt. Perfect with leggings or jeans.
review.name: Comfortable flattering top!

review.reviewBody: Docking one star for itch, I wish this had a thin liner. Otherwise warm, cute and perfect.
review.name: A Bit Itchy But That’s Price of Wool

review.reviewBody: I'm a flannel fiend and this one is my go-to. It's well-made, feels thick and substantial—definitely wears more like a light jacket. I wear small or medium in tops and got this in a medium, which leaves room to wear a long sleeve underneath. I hope that it keeps coming out in more colorways because I'd get them all!
review.name: Top-tier flannel

review.reviewBody: I received this wool shirt for my birthday and I recently took it with me on a 6 night canoe trip. It was perfect to wear around the campfire and not worry about the sparks. I wore it every day from wake up to bedtime. It was perfect for cool temperatures, while paddling the canoe and even during rain showers it kept me dry. A 'must' item to bring on my next outdoor trip and will look into getting for other members of the family. It is a bit itchy (wore a long sleeve top underneath on this trip due to the cool temperatures) but am told that after a few washes it will soften up.
review.name: Perfect for backpacking, canoeing, campfire

review.reviewBody: This is one of my favorite flannels. This flannel is very warm and great for a weekend in  the woods or walking around town. It is a great weight for fall by itself or layered up in the colder months. A somewhat relaxed fit that is great for moving around but still looks fitted. Runs slightly large.
review.name: Best Flannel

name: Canada Long-Sleeve Shirt - Women's

description: Buy the Chaco Paonia Desert Boot - Men's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Paonia Desert Boot - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Chaco Paonia Desert Boot - Men's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I wore desert boots aka chukkas when I was in high school in the 1950's. I always liked them & thought I'd give these a try. I wear a 10 or 10.5 and the 10's were a bit big but I added an insert & now they fit great. I find the toe box roomy, so that's good for me. Since they're now on sale I think I'll get another pair. I'm wondering about the elastic tongue restrainers---do I really need them? They seem to make it a bit clumsy to get into the shoes. Other than that I really like them.
review.name: Old desert boots return

review.reviewBody: Fan of Chaco sandals. Have several pairs. Got a pair of these chukkas for a 3 week trip to Italy in October. Walked 20-22k steps a day. No foot pain what so ever! There absolutely is arch support. It’s built into the Chaco footbed. When I returned from vacation I purchased two more pairs. I wear these to work. I work in manufacturing. I average about 15k steps a day on concrete floors. I don’t have any foot pain. LOVE these shoes! Hope Chaco continues to make them.
review.name: Most Comfortable Shoes I’ve Ever Owned

review.reviewBody: I wore desert boots all through high school.  So I decided it was time to wear them again now that I'm in my 70's.  These were an amazing bargain purchase.  They are very comfortable but have very little arch support.  I solved that with a pair of old Keen inserts.  They fit much better now.  And with the back pulls, added on these new pair, very easy to get on even with the elastic tongue holders.  Are they really water proof?  Time will tell.
review.name: Desert Boots again

review.reviewBody: Seemed comfortable but they were too big. No smaller size available in men's and the women's Paonia styles are way too narrow.
review.name: Had potential

review.reviewBody: I find these to be poorly designed in that the top opening is too narrow to comfortably insert your foot. They are kind of a hassle to put on. Once on they feel OK for short period use, lots of room inside of nice wide and boxy shape. However they are definitely not very comfortable for long periods of time as they lack any kind of cushioning or internal support.
review.name: Nice but not really functional

review.reviewBody: Most comfortable shoes I have ever owned. They are well made and quite the casual style for everyday use.
review.name: Desert chukka boots

review.reviewBody: These may be the most comfortable non athletic shoes I own. I had to go a size down to get the right fit though. I highly recommend them.
review.name: Crazy comfortable!
comment: Thanks for your feedback and the recommendation!

review.reviewBody: Lovely soft upper, with great supportive flexible sole, lovely.
review.name: Lovely soft upper, with great supportive flexible

review.reviewBody: I am a woman with a size 8.5-9 foot. These , in a men’s 7 are slightly too large. I love the look and the wide toe box. I do not know if the soles are non-slip nor if they are waterproof.
review.name: Nice looking shoe
comment: We appreciate your feedback. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: Poor design,  no sock insert, you're standing on rubber.
review.name: Sad
comment: We appreciate your feedback. Thank you.

name: Paonia Desert Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Spendy, but you get what you pay for with Cataract oars. They’re muuuuch more supple than Carlisles, which means they don’t beat you up as much. That makes a big difference. 
Relatively light, and a lot less maintenance compared to wooden oars.

description: Buy the Reima Vesi Raincoat - Boys' online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Vesi Raincoat - Boys'
hasVariant.description: Buy the Reima Vesi Raincoat - Boys' online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Good jacket, great rain pants. My son had them out on a rainy afternoon hike in the woods. Had some good steady rain and we were out for a couple hours. He remained dry throughout his adventures. Jacket hood is well designed, stayed in place and moved well with him so he maintained a good field of view. He did have a complaint that there were no pockets to place his collection of twigs, autumnal leaves, and snail shells. So, 4 out of 5 stars for the jacket pockets would be great. 5 out of 5 for the pants.
review.name: Vesi Rain Jacket

review.reviewBody: We don't get much rain so the jacket lives in my child's backpack. Our climate is quite hot so most rain jackets eventually delaminate. But this one is constructed differently so I am hopeful that if rain comes the rain jacket will work when needed.
review.name: Great rain jacket.

review.reviewBody: The rain jacket and rain hat I bought were both very practical and were made very well! Spent more than I usually do, but the jacket has lots of room for growth. The hats seem a little small, so size up for room to grow.
review.name: Awesome quality

review.reviewBody:
Great set! We bought 3 sets and they were great for hiking and fishing. Great for layering and kept the kids dry when we encountered some rain. 
Will purchase as the kids grow
review.name: Great set! We bought 3

review.reviewBody: I love the quality of these raincoats! They keep my girls dry on rainy days!
review.name: I love the quality of

review.reviewBody: Way too tight for kids with wide chubby feet, do not recommend
review.name: Toddler boots

review.reviewBody: Cute print! Looks great! Will have lots of use! Paired this with Jam bottoms and match great!
review.name: Cute Print!

review.reviewBody: High quality, love the pattern, definitely will need to grow into. We got the 18-24 month for our 18 month old and have to cuff the sleeves a good amount. The description does mention room to grow :)
review.name: Great quality rain jacket

review.reviewBody: Great quality rain jacket! It fits a little big and it’s perfect.
Adorable. Great quality. Size 6 fits my tall 6 year old perfectly.
review.name: Adorable. Great quality. Size 6

name: Vesi Raincoat - Boys'

hasVariant.name: Keb Agile Winter Trouser - Men's

hasVariant.name: Keb Agile Winter Trouser - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Fjallraven Keb Agile Winter Trouser - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Soft on the inside & warm overall. The side zipper’s to vent while pushing up hill are awesome!
review.name: Super cool/cold weather pants

review.reviewBody: Love these pants, warm, comfortable and when necessary breathable.  I was hoping to buy a second pair for myself and another pair for someone for Christmas in 34-34 but have been waiting a month for a restock.
review.name: Great pants, need restock.

review.reviewBody: Quality pants with good features. Sizing is on the small size - I glad I've read reviews and have ordered 34 while my regular size is 32. The fabric stretches well, is pleasant to the touch, not rough but quite durable. The pants are not insulated, it's just a soft shell with a thin liner. I wouldn't wear them in significant minus temperatures, even with a warm base layer. As for hunting/outdoor work pants, I miss the ability to insert knee pads. This would make these pants ideal for active use in the late season. A little bit pricey but definitely of high quality.
review.name: Good pants for active use in cold

review.reviewBody: I bought a pair 3 years ago and wore it practically ever day tromping through the woods.  Excellent choice in protective clothing.
review.name: Supreme Outdoor Protection

review.reviewBody: Purchased in the off-season so haven't used yet, but planning to live in these guys this winter while cross country skiing, early/late season downhill, and winter bike commuting.
review.name: Perfect active winter pants

review.reviewBody:
I am in Canada and I use them in -15 with no underlayer, I go out in the Fall with them. They are all black so it is acceptable to go work with them. Super comfortable and stretchy. I go climbing, bouldering, and biking on them. I simply cannot express how happy I am with this model. I also have Abisko and Vidda Pro but this ones are my favourite! If I need to get dirty or something more
physical like construction, gardening, renos, lots of mud while hiking, Vidda Pro are better. However, this are way more comfortable.
review.name: Best purchase I ever made.

review.reviewBody:
I recently put the Fjallraven Keb Agile Winter Trousers to the test on hikes in Iceland and Colorado, and I was thoroughly impressed. Whether I was navigating snowy Icelandic trails or trekking through the crisp Colorado mountains, these pants kept me warm, dry, and comfortable throughout.

The Keb Agile Winter Trousers are constructed from a durable, weather-resistant fabric that effectively shielded me from the elements. The wind and occasional snow flurries in Iceland were no match for these pants, and they kept me comfortable during my Colorado hike where the temperatures dipped quite low.
What truly surprised me was the trousers' flexibility. Despite their winter-ready build, they offered exceptional freedom of movement, allowing me to traverse challenging terrain with ease. This was especially beneficial when scrambling over rocks or navigating steep inclines.

Overall, the Fjallraven Keb Agile Winter Trousers are a fantastic choice for winter hiking adventures. Their combination of warmth, durability, and comfort makes them a reliable companion for treks in various cold-weather conditions.
review.name: Terrific hiking in the winter

review.reviewBody: I just wore these for a week of active touring in Iceland, including glaciers and snow hiking. They did great. The sizing worked out fine based on reading the guide, they were comfortable throughout with a pair of long underwear under them, and even though a week isn't that long to go by, they did not snag on anything or take any damage (and there were opportunities for that to be sure).
review.name: worth it

review.reviewBody:
Just got them but they’re already my favourite pants; I own Greenland jeans and original Keb trousers and I love both of them but these are super comfortable and well thought out as well. 
Having both thigh pockets zipper is a great improvement though I do with they still had the flaps over the zippers.
review.name: Favourite pants

review.reviewBody: Amazing!  Just warm enough for winter hikes but not too warm. The vents make it easy to regulate temps. I am taking them up Cayambe in Ecuador tomorrow!
review.name: Perfect pants

name: Keb Agile Winter Trouser - Men's

review.reviewBody: Waterproof means the water doesn’t soak through the jacket not getting absolutely drenched from light rain.
review.name: Waterproof means the water doesn’t

review.reviewBody: Love the jacket. Exactly what I wanted. A lightweight throw on for gentle hiking that could be carried in a small shoulder bag or even a pocket that can be whipped out for protection in a jiffy if the rain came.
review.name: Love the jacket. Exactly what

review.reviewBody: Good fit for summer use. Patches of apparent water absorption on the outer surface made me suspicious about water penetration, but none was apparent on the inner surface.
review.name: Good fit for summer use.

review.reviewBody:
The jacket is very nice to look at. 
I got the black one, the water proofing seems to be doing a fine job so far. No water through yet. It also folds up nice and small. The website seems to indicate it’s heavily wind proof, I strongly disagree with this. In high winds there’s definitely lack in performance. I noticed the cheaper model has pit zips for ventilation but this model doesn’t despite costing more, but if a shame. The pull cord found in the hood which tightens it around your head, sits right on the ear…not very comfortable at all. Personally wouldn’t recommend. Spend that bit more and find something GORTEX.
review.name: The jacket is very nice

review.reviewBody: This jacket is really light and coupled with other Rab gear the freedom of movement is excellent oh and yes its waterproof. P.S. Can you make one for my Dog.
review.name: This jacket is really light

review.reviewBody:
First, as an FYI, light khaki isn’t khaki, it’s olive green. I happen to like the green better, so I’m not disappointed, but color is misleading. 

Very lightweight jacket. Fit is perfect. I am 6’2” and 230lbs. XL is ideal. Not bulky like some XL, rather athletic cut. Sleeve length is adequate for longer arms. 

The only thing I don’t love is the feel of the liner against my arms when wearing short sleeves. Sorta rubber feeling.
review.name: So far so good

review.reviewBody: Honestly, this is such an awesome jacket. Bought it to have stashed in my back pack for light summer hill walks, but actually this is even great in current rainy and windy conditions and about 8 degrees / feels like 4. Would definitely recommend!
review.name: The perfect lightweight jacket

name: Downpour Light Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Bought these for a heli ski trip , they pack small , so nice to let the feet be unrestricted after a full day in boots, they worked exactly as I had hoped 
Bonus I think they will get to see a lot more cool places because they will be part of the kit going forward!
review.name: After Riding foot comfort

review.reviewBody: These fit just as expected, are super warm, have a very reliable sole, and stay on my feet with or without socks on.
review.name: Definitely glad I purchased these booties.

review.reviewBody: Ces pantoufles sont parfaites à la maison. Portées sans bas, je n'ai pas les pieds humides comme avec d'autres pantoufles. Elles sont parfaites pour les journées en télétravail et les soirées bien relax!
review.name: Chaud et confortable

review.reviewBody: These are comfortable and WARM. I wear an 11 in most shoes and the mediums fit me well.
review.name: Cold feet are for chumps…

review.reviewBody: These are a slipper. Love the slide on ability and the warmth. Good traction also helps with running around outside.
review.name: Super Comfy

review.reviewBody: Haven't had a chance to use these apres ski yet but they are comfortable when breaking camp after a hike. Easy to get on and stylish. Very warm as well.
review.name: Comfy and functional

review.reviewBody: These are hands down one of the strangest, but best purchases that I have ever made. I bought them as kind of a joke for my wife because, lets be honest, THEY ARE DOWN BOOTIES. She rolled her eyes so hard at them, but when we were in the hotel, they were so warm and so comfy that we almost never took them off. We would walk the dogs in the snow in them and our feet were so toasty. The next weekend we took them out camping and I'll tell you what, morning bathroom breaks aren't so bad when you have down wrapped around your feet.
review.name: Best Hotel/Camp Shoe Ever.

author.name: OR Employee - Mikey J - Customer Service

review.reviewBody: I'm stoked on these slippers. They slide on and off with ease and provide ample warmth. They even have the ability to slide over the heal to prevent them from slipping off when walking on a slope.
review.name: Warmth that's easy to slide on and off

review.reviewBody: I bought these for when I go outside. They fit comfortably and I feel like I have secure footing when wearing them.
review.name: Very comfortable and high quality

review.reviewBody: Warm, but not sweaty especially if work with socks. Great for use around the house on chilly days. Also good to keep near a door for quick trip outside around the house and back. Will be fantastic for camping season! Sizing guide was true, just touch generous actually (whereas most of my OR items I had to size upmfrom the charts). I'm a size 11-12 USmens and size Large leaves some wiggle room, making them easy-on, easy-off. Great grip on the sole too.
review.name: Sweet multi-use slippers!

name: Tundra Trax Slip-On Booties - Men's

review.itemreviewed: TDF Guidoline Perforated Classic Bar Tape
review.reviewBody: I love this bar tape. My go to is usually Fizik, but when I can get this on sale, it’s much better. First of all, it feels very close to leather, using a high quality synthetic that doesn’t separate. An issue I’ve had with Deda, and Fizik. The top layer of dye separates, leaving the ugly under layer after a couple hundred miles. After a couple years its pretty well had it. So far, it’s only been a summer, and it show no wear. This material reminds me of what Sidi uses for their faux leather on their shoes. As an added bonus, I think it’s made in France, unlike the far east for most other premium brands. Lastly, the feel of this tape is very close to leather. It wraps so much easier than Fizik, which is an all out nightmare to get smooth. This tape lays perfectly.
review.name: Supple, yet durable.

name: TDF Guidoline Perforated Classic Bar Tape
