review.reviewBody: I've done about 200 miles in these shoes and I find them very comfortable with a wide toe box and no pressure points.  I have these in size 42 and I own another pair of lake CX 241s in the same size.  The CX 241s are snug all around and once they're dialed in they don't need any adjusting mid ride.  The 238's are a wee bit larger both in length and width even though they're both made by Lake and size 42.  I find that I have to adjust the left shoe a couple of times during every ride.  I'm deducing that it has to do with the leather upper which I imagine becomes stretched as it warms up and gets moist.  However, the BOA system shouldn't be affected by heat and moisture, so I'm not sure what's up with the need to adjust.  The carbon sole is excellent and there is no loss in energy during the transfer of power to the pedals.  Overall a good shoe although I'm leaning more to the CX241s at this point.  Aesthetically, they're a good looking shoe, especially in the all white.
review.name: Very comfortable/wide toe box

review.reviewBody:
I finally found the perfect shoe. Size 49 Lake CX238 is my new 100 mile shoe. Stiff carbon soles, real leather uppers, totally adjustable boas. I've never been so comfortable. They weren't cheap but for comfort, I don't care.

As a big foot, I've suffered with numbness and cramping toes (aka hotfoot) for years. Cycling shoes just aren't an easy fit in a size 14 (not wide). They're usually too tight In a regular width and too wide in "wide".  Or the sole Is not stiff enough in models that come in a size 49/50.  I've tried Bont moldable shoes (too high arch), Shimano's in various width, Specialized regular and wide width. Cramping usually starts around mile 25 into mile 40. 50 milers are always a struggle requiring some dancing on the pedals.

I really can feel the Improvement In power transfer and it shows in my stats. Simply Incredible.

Regarding size-most road shoes in this size run a little tight. This is as roomy as my trail runner shoes. So if you compensate for typical bike shoes being small, do t. Size up one
review.name: Found my perfect road shoe after 15 year

review.reviewBody:
Before ordering this shoe I went through the Lake measuring process and came up with a size that probably would have been to small. Lake recommended a size 43 but I've been wearing size 44 in all my shoes for ages. As it turns out the size 43.5 is perfect for my foot. 

As has been pointed out, these shoes don't really offer the slim, speedy look of a lot of shoes but the wider toebox is perfect and solved my numb foot problem. 

Another feature I like that was missing in my previous brands of shoes was a BOA system that is two way. I can reach down and open up or close down the system one click at a time as opposed to having to stop, release the BOA and then retighten.
review.name: Great shoe for my problem feet

review.reviewBody:
Just got a pair of the black CX238 road shoes, size 43.5. That new leather smell as you open the box. This is now my fourth pair of 238 range shoes, between road and mountain shoes. Yes, I have a problem. But the Lake 238 shoes fit my feet perfectly, no hot spots, no pinching or crushing of the toes, they are just the perfect shoes for my foot shape. Run maybe just a bit small compared to other shoes, most other shoes I've had have been size 43. Or perhaps the Lakes are just true to size and the others were a bit off. 

Started with a burgundy pair, then just had to get the white, and now this black pair, to go along with my beetle/black mountain shoes. And may just have to get a pair of the new fluo yellow/red road shoes.
review.name: Just great shoes

review.reviewBody: I came from a pair of Fizik R5B shoes that tapered too much. The toe box on these Lake shoes is just perfect as it leaves room for some swelling that occurs after the first hour or so on the bike. They have a hugging heal cup with a great shape, plus the matereal ensures there is no lift. Very Happy so far. I picked them out of a large group of shoes that I tried at the same time.
review.name: Great feeling footbed

review.reviewBody: These shoes feel amazing!  Used sizing guidance on the Lake website and fit is just right.  I had North Wave shoes that I thought were ok but were too narrow and tightness got worse when I added better insoles with more arch support.  These Lakes have more width and volume and are so comfortable!  The quality is evident and the natural leather is supple and but supportive.  Can dial in just right with the boa dials.  Shoes are so critical to how comfortable and enjoyable your cycling experience will be.  I should have prioritized this purchase long ago!
review.name: Why didn't I buy these sooner?

review.reviewBody: The first time I put them on, even before I attached the cleats, I knew they were keepers.  I had not planned to spend that much money.  They have a large toe box which is just what I need while the upper softly hugs your foot.  The arch is nice These are my first shoes with carbon soles.  What a difference.  Pedaling is like being on an elliptical like you?re whole foot is applying pressure.  Lake has won me over..
review.name: Best shoe I?ve owned

review.reviewBody:
After trying on, buying, and selling countless shoes I finally found my perfect fit: the CX237. I rode the CX237 for a year before the inner lining tore and I had them replaced with the CX238. I've been riding the CX238 now for a year and three months.

For those of us with wonky feet, the wonderful fit of the CX237 carries over to the CX238 (I have duck feet). The inner lining is significantly more durable than the CX237. The tongue and ventilation are a bit better. The cleat alignment marks are still crooked. The BOAs are still wonderful.

With approximately 7,500 miles and 360 hours, they are still going. My riding has been 70% outside in moderate to high heat and 50-90% humidity and 30% on an indoor trainer. By now the upper lip of the tongue has lost its pliability (not nearly as badly as the CX237) and the outer leather, near the inner ball of my foot, has started to tear. I have done nothing to care for them, though. Perhaps proactive leather conditioner would turn these into 15,000+ mile shoes?
review.name: Worthy Successor to the CX237

review.reviewBody:
I have not ridden with these yet. I used the chart, and ordered what I thought was the correct size, 44.5 (same as my current Shimanos). They were too small. Have returned them for 45s, and hoping they fit. But according to that chart someone with an 11.5 shoe should use a 45. no way my feet are that big.

Update: The 45s arrived and they are a perfect fit. After one 35 mile ride it's easy to tell how good these shoes are. Comfortable, and a really stiff sole. Also have good arch support and a comfortable heel cup. Excellent shoes.
review.name: Sizing? (updated)

review.reviewBody:
I really like this shoe.  I have bought lots of different shoes looking for the perfect fit and look,   This is the first shoe that is comfortable and where I don't get any slip in my heal.  I have a high instep and narrow heal.  To accommodate my instep I normally have to buy an 11 in shoes and sneaker even though my foot measures a 10/10.5.  This has been an issue in cycling shoes because the extra length means lots of heal slippage.  If I crank if down to prevent that, my arch gets crushed.  With Lake I can a nice fit, no heal slippage and no pain.   
But, the Lake is not the sleekest looking shoe on the market.  But I will trade performance over style any day.  
Lake also has a great sizing protocol on their website.  Follow it, it works!
review.name: Finally

name: CX238 Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: I'm normally always a medium, but on the chart, i'm a small with the Candide C2 pant. That, combined with the extra-baggy cut, means that this pant is a boat. Even compared with the HellyHansen small, this is an inch longer, and another inch around the leg. In the end, I rejected it because it was just too baggy. I went with the Black Diamond Recon, a much lighter fabric, more form-fitting, and fits me really well. Sorry, I reeally wanted to love this candide pant, with it's sliky smooth fabric, nice cut, high-tech 3L fabric, but no deal on this pant.
review.name: baggy

review.reviewBody: beautiful shoes that make all the ladies jelly keys get it fam

review.reviewBody: These shoes are gorgeous I got a ton of compliments when I went to pick them up from the store and tried them on, but read the comments they run big so go I full size down I’m usually a 7 1/2 but I ordered a 6 1/2 and they fit perfect
review.name: Love these

review.reviewBody:
I’ve been wearing 5-tens for ages now and they are my go to bike shoes, these are a great colour and with the added personalisation a standard shoes becomes unique to its wearer..
Love em
review.name: Great shoes, great colour with a personal touch

review.reviewBody: Nice purchase will re but when my size in stock so pleased
review.name: too big so had to return otherwise cute well made

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It grips to my pedals well. I thought the pink color would be brown because of the dirt, yet it wipes off, a nice MTB female shoe. I like it.
review.name: Works well

review.reviewBody:
I ordered women’s sleuth mtb. The sizing is definitely off. It’s says Slueth W (which I assume means women’s) 6.5 on the outer tag and inside says 6.5 us and my feet are swimming in them. Which makes me believe they are men’s sizing not women’s 
The shoe is pretty and it seems very comfortable although I could really walk around due to the size. I am a true 6.5 in most shoes and a 7 in some due to a wide foot. 
I had no issues with exchanging the first pair due to size and now returning these ones for the same reason 
Attached is a photo of a similar style shoe that is a women’s 7 and you will see there is a huge difference.
review.name: Pretty but way toooo big

review.reviewBody:
Sure! Here's the translation:

"I bought these shoes at the beginning of the month, and I got them at a good price. They are nice and comfortable, but the size runs a little big. I love it!
review.name: My mtb shoe

review.reviewBody: The Five Ten Sleuth Mountain Bike shoes combine style and function, featuring a sleek design suitable for both biking and casual wear. Their Stealth S1 rubber outsole provides excellent grip on flat pedals, while the cushioned midsole and breathable materials ensure comfort for all-day use. A versatile and reliable choice.
review.name: Best shoes ever

review.reviewBody:
it was my 3rd pair of Five Ten Sleuth. Ordered a man 9 1/2 US.
Always ordered 9 1/2 US in the past  
My 2 others were 9 1/2 US / 9 UK / 43 1/2 FR / 275JP / 265CH.
But this one is 9 1/2 US / 8 UK / 42 FR / 265JP / 260CH !!!!!!!
review.name: Wrong size/Wrong TAG or New sizing chart !!!!!!

name: Sleuth Cycling Shoe - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the SOREL Whitney II Strap Boot - Toddler Girls' online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Whitney II Strap Boot - Toddler Girls'
review.reviewBody: Sizing is off and they are so narrow that I can’t put them on my baby.
review.name: Sizing is off
comment: Hello Rachel, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We’re sorry that our Toddler Whitney™ II Strap Boot is hard to size. We’re happy to help rectify the issue if you will reach out to our support team at (888) My-SOREL. Thank you.

review.itemreviewed: Whitney II Strap Boot - Toddler Girls'
review.reviewBody: These shoes are awesome! I bought them for my very busy 20 month old. The tongue goes all the way down so they’re easy to put on. I love that they are insulated and waterproof. He’s been wearing them whenever we go out of the house. I ordered a size up just to make sure they would fit with a thicker socks. They are much easier to put on than other winter boots I have purchased.
review.name: Wonderful winter boots for kids

review.itemreviewed: Whitney II Strap Boot - Toddler Girls'
review.reviewBody: Bought these last year and my son does love them and says they are very comfortable. We live in in a snowy climate for 4 months of the year and almost every time my son wears these they get completely soaked through to his socks. I wouldn’t even call them water resistant. Pretty disappointing for the price point. We still love Sorel for snow boots and will keep buying but these missed the mark
review.name: Comfortable but not waterproof at all
comment: Hello JLSNI, we appreciate you sharing your feedback and we're sorry Toddler Whitney™ II Strap Boot didn't meet your standards. We will inform our product team of your concerns and ensure this is fixed for the future.

review.itemreviewed: Whitney II Strap Boot - Toddler Girls'
review.reviewBody: Don't ask me "How do I like my new shoes?" when you haven't even shipped them yet. Been waiting weeks. Maybe don't release these emails until you've verified you've shipped a customer's order.
review.name: Gee, I wish I knew if I liked my new shoes.

review.itemreviewed: Whitney II Strap Boot - Toddler Girls'
review.reviewBody: These boots are beautiful! We got them as a gift for a first bday. Unfortunately they were too small for my boys feet.. we sized up but they were still not good enough for his fat feet. And unfortunately again, they’ve been out of stock in like every size in our desired color so we can’t re-order. Hoping to get them for winter..
review.name: So cute, but

review.itemreviewed: Whitney II Strap Boot - Toddler Girls'
review.reviewBody: Bought these for my daughter with a little hesitation about the price but we absolutely love them!! We had other boots that my daughter would fight putting on every day and since we tried these she does not fight putting on her boots. They are lightweight, not clunky like other boots and are so stinkin adorable!! Will look for them next year when we have to size up as she grows!
review.name: Absolutely love!

review.itemreviewed: Whitney II Strap Boot - Toddler Girls'
review.reviewBody: I bought these for my son twice. They are great because they are not bulky and they keep his feet warm. However, they are not waterproof-water resistant maybe but feet do get wet if he goes on the snow. Thats the only con.
review.name: Light weight but NOT waterproof

review.itemreviewed: Whitney II Strap Boot - Toddler Girls'
review.reviewBody:
We’ve been using them in cold damp conditions in the UK Lake District and the my have been really good. They keep my toddler’s feet warm and dry...
They are narrow so we sized up and with use they’ve become easy to put on. We removed the weirdly build-up (by 5mm!, please urgently revise!)  insole though to achieve this. 
Love the grip but would prefer a more barefoot boot/ less stiffness. Still, the combination of grip and waterproofing was a winner for us
review.name: Warm, waterproof, grippy

review.itemreviewed: Whitney II Strap Boot - Toddler Girls'
review.reviewBody: These are perfect for my 1 year old, he walks well in them and they keep his feet dry and warm. They are also easy to put on in comparison to other baby shoes. We get a lot of compliments on these boots! I will buy again when we need to size up.
review.name: Love these boots!

review.itemreviewed: Whitney II Strap Boot - Toddler Girls'
review.reviewBody: The boots appeared like they would open wide enough for my toddler but they were not easy to get on his foot. Seemed to be narrow. I wanted a boot that would slip on his foot quickly and easily and these weren’t that for us.
review.name: Cute boot but was narrow

name: Whitney II Strap Boot - Toddler Girls'

description: Buy the Evolv Sling Flip Flop - Men's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Sling Flip Flop - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Evolv Sling Flip Flop - Men's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Literally every pair of flip-flop style sandals I've purchased in the last 20 years, whether $70+ adventure sport models from premium brands, or $10 drugstore throw-aways, the foot-bed of a size 9 extended at least slightly beyond my actual footprint, providing ample protection and comfort all around. With these size 9 sandals from Evolv the back of my heel is directly over the back edge of the sandal, and the tips of my toes extend slightly beyond the front of the footbed.  They may be passably adequate for a quick walk from the pool to the locker room (or something like that) but they are way too small for anything else.
review.name: Way smaller than industry standards

review.reviewBody:
these are so comfortable, love the fit, but.... the rubber sole separates from the foam base in no time at all.  i thought maybe it was an issue with the first pair i had so i purchased a second set, and within 1 month the rubber bottom has begun to separate from the foam sole again.  

Their customer service recommended re-gluing it, which i had done with the first pair but didn't hold, not super impressed

find another pair of sandals that will last you longer than a month.
review.name: do not buy, the sole will fall off

review.reviewBody:
fit ok, I'd say the sizing tracks.  Maybe a tiny bit of the small side.
My bigger issue is longevity.  I got these start of summer, and wore them all summer.  Definitely heavy use, I put many miles on them mostly on sidewalks.  I used them for fishing too, which definitely pushes flip flops to the edge (rocks, mud, slipping, etc), but I didn't go that much.  Good for the price (not including shipping), but I expected them to be more durable.  I would imagine they would be solid for less intense use, I literally wore them every day, sometimes for a couple miles
Very grippy and comfortable. Sizing is off. I normally where an 11.5 and ordered a 12 which fit my daughters size 9.5 and 10 feet.  I have now ordered size 13 for myself and I think it will work.

name: Sling Flip Flop - Men's

description: Buy the Black Diamond Powder Basket online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Powder Basket
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Powder Basket online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: used the og ones for years and these are a great upgrade. get stuck less in that icey stuff
review.name: These are great improvements

review.reviewBody: Cannot do without! Supple. Bends with the snow pack. Wouldn’t buy anything else.
review.name: Premier basket.

review.reviewBody:
These screw-on baskets easily dislodge from the pole in snow. 
 The previous ones I got from you were more durable since they had an additional lock-in mechanism.
 The recent ones do not have that lock-in feature. Too bad! I won't buy them again.
review.name: These screw-on baskets easily dislodge

review.reviewBody: In a world where tiny racing baskets are too commonplace and standard on a new set of poles, these can right the wrong! What use is a pole that sinks? Probably the best budget friendly upgrade to your touring kit or inbounds powder rig.
review.name: Bigger is Better

review.reviewBody: I bought them for a resort trip like a noob, but in comparison to the cheap ones I have, the materials are choice. Flexible yet sturdy. Can’t wait to actually put them to the test.
review.name: Quality baskets

review.reviewBody: Great to have access to spare baskets. A mechanic’s vice means they will stay put.
review.name: Spare parts

review.reviewBody: When they're on, they're great, providing tons of floatation and keeping poles well above even powdery snow. I've had several work themselves free in the last few seasons, though - the threaded connection could be a bit better.
review.name: Solid when they stay on

review.reviewBody: They thread on to the poles but don't seem to lock on. They don't seem to be the correct baskets. I'm disappointed as these are no longer available in stores. I was told to try online and now I'm stuck with these!
review.name: Buyer beware!

review.reviewBody: Hi everyone, do the powder baskets fit on all the poles of Black Diamond, more precisely on the distance series?
review.name: Compatibility with poles

review.reviewBody: I have Salomon S3 All-mountain poles but I wanted a powder basket on them. I was able to swap the basket with these Black Diamonds and they fit perfectly. I followed the other reviewer's suggestion to use a hair drier to heat the pole and the basket which made installation much easier.
review.name: Works with Salomon S3 poles

name: Powder Basket

description: Buy the KAVU Trailrunner Hat online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Trailrunner Hat
hasVariant.description: Buy the KAVU Trailrunner Hat online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This hat rips in the way you want a hat to rip. I sweat A LOT on hikes and just in general working out. Most ballcap style hats let the sweat drip down my forehead, this hat helps mitigate that by wicking the sweat back toward the ears with a forehead band. Also lots of ventilation helps loads. I wear a 7.75" fitted cap and it fits with a lil room left in the adjustment band.
review.name: Great for heavy activity

review.reviewBody: Awesome breathability with adjustable fit. Wore on several long trail runs and works great.
review.name: Great running hat!

review.reviewBody:
I’ve been wearing Kavu strap caps and the synthetic strap cap just about every day for almost 10yrs.
I finally decided to spring for the trail runner hat for hotter summer days. For all of the hats I’ve bought I’ve been a true medium. My head isn’t too big or small. For some reason this medium trail cap is fitting very snuggly on my head even though there’s still plenty of slack on the strap; to the point where ordering a large seems like it would be way to big around my head. Not sure if this is how this hat fits or if this one is a dud?
review.name: Trail Runner ran oddly small for me

review.reviewBody: I bought the khaki color and the black in a size m and love the fit, look, and feel.
review.name: Love

review.reviewBody: I’ve ran a few ultras in this hat and it is my favorite! I like that the bill is short so it doesn’t block my vision. The strap on the back is really quick to adjust, the panels dry and breathe well, it keeps my hair out of my face and the sun off my head! Really cute too. 10/10
review.name: Perfect running hat

review.reviewBody: Got to wear the hat a handful of times before the strap that holds the buckle came un sewn. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND IF YOU VALUE DURABILITY.
review.name: Cheap workman

name: Trailrunner Hat

review.reviewBody: I like the pattern and the wool.  After using for a few times I think for the price I would go with icebreaker or Smartwool.  The quality seems better.
review.name: Pattern nice

review.reviewBody: This is the cutest/best merino top I’ve ever found! It keeps me so warm! I usually only need this layer and my ski coat unless it’s really cold then I’ll layer a puffy as well. I love the snowflake print with the solid neck! Such flattering base layer and I get so many compliments on the fucha color on the skin track when I’m just wearing this under my bibs! Whether you’re skiing, touring, apres-ing or lounging this is a must have set! Also, the odor resistance is awesome, I probably wash once a week and ski in it daily! True to size
review.name: Functional and Stylish!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great Summer season bag, comfortable leg room. Bought a wawona 20 as well and that is the bag to get for temps below 50 I'd say. This 35 degree bag required a blanket when Temps went below 50, just not much filling in it, the wawona 20 has much more

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the bag. Pattern is dope. Zipper can be difficult to pull sometimes.
review.name: Love the bag. Pattern is dope. Zipper can be difficult to pu

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My husband and I recently upgraded our sleeping bags, and we purchased the North Face Wawona Bed 35 long (he is 6'2") Sleeping Bag for my husband and the Wawona Bed 20 regular (I'm 5'5") Sleeping Bag for me. As avid tent campers, we wanted an upgrade from our mummy bags with more room to move but something that would still keep us really warm for camping in Northern Minnesota on the North Shore of Lake Superior. The North Face Wawona Bed 35 Long Sleeping Bag impressed us with its durability and warmth. The temperatures at night dropped into the 40's, with a chilly Lake Superior wind but this sleeping bag kept my husband so warm and comfortable throughout the entire night he slept in boxers and a t-shirt. It strikes the perfect balance between warmth and comfort. The insulation does a remarkable job of trapping heat, so you stay warm without feeling overly bulky or restricted in movement. Another great feature worth mentioning is the heavy-duty zippers on the bag. They are a game-changer in the dark at night, they glide smoothly without any snags or jams and make it easy to move around. Additionally, I love that the bag can unzip the entire way around so even in the warmer months you can use it as a top cover or blanket for more versatility. Overall, I would highly recommend the North Face Wawona Bed 35 Sleeping Bag. It's warm, comfortable, and built to last thanks to its heavy-duty zippers and excellent insulation. My husband and I had an amazing fall camping trip in northern MN and slept warm and comfortable! If you're looking for a versatile sleeping bag that will keep you warm and cozy in colder conditions, this is definitely the bag to go for!
review.name: Fantastic Warmth and Durability for Cold Nights!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great bag. Looking forward to putting it to use in the warmer camping months.
review.name: I would definitely buy again.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great bag for anything! Love the color too
review.name: Love North face gear!

name: Wawona Bed Sleeping Bag: 35F Synthetic

description: Buy the Saris M2 Smart Trainer online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: M2 Smart Trainer
hasVariant.description: Buy the Saris M2 Smart Trainer online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This was my first trainer and I am so happy this is the one I purchased! I have been using it for 4 years now and am so pleased with the small footprint, the fast, easy set up, the compatibility with my road bike (or anyone else's who wanted to use it with their bike easily), and that it came with a bluetooth sensor that could track my cadence on a cycling app. I use the Peloton app and find this a great way to get a quick workout in without having to buy a Peloton and watch my road bike collect dust. Perfect price point as well and quality material.
review.name: Great Trainer!

review.reviewBody: Purchasing the m2 definitely changed my life for the better. Allows for a no excuses mindset. No more saying it’s too hot or too windy to cycle, just have to set it up and get after it. Easy setup out of box and quick install of the bike whenever you want to ride. Only issue is the clutch knob. It’s simply just inconsistent. Mine clicks but my average calibration is 2-3 seconds. Didn’t think anything of it but when I rode my bike on the road (when I got the trainer and used it, it was the first time I’d cycled in over a year) it seemed noticeably easier to pedal. Upon this I deep dived into calibration and ended up finding some posts saying that the calibration should be between 4-10 seconds. With this knowledge I turned the clutch knobs 3ish full rotations (takes much more to make it click) and got my calibration to 4 seconds and found it much more realistic. While this might be a tad annoying it isn’t asking the customer to do to much. Having to hop off the bike to adjust the clutch if I’m not in my optimal calibration window isn’t the end of the world. Only other issue I’ve seen is when I go to stand up and pedal hard it seems like I lose resistance from the trainer. This could be common with a wheel on trainer but as this is the first trainer I’ve ever purchased I don’t have any references to go off of. Product works fine and is a great tool to help keep myself accountable and achieve my goals.
review.name: Works well but don’t trust the knob

review.reviewBody: I've had my M2 now for about 2 1/2 years and it's by far the best trainer I've ever had...smart or not.  It's durable, stable and has worked well with both Zwift and Rouvy although I dropped Zwift as it got boring with the limited courses compared to Rouvy.  I do agree with other reviewers regarding setting the tension.  Turning it until it clicks makes for a much harder ride, particularly when you start, and it will wear out your tires quickly.  I turn it until it firmly connects with the tire and then hold the flywheel and try to move the wheel.  If it doesn't slip, then it's perfect.  I don't have the room for a a permanent setup so the off-wheel trainers were not an option for me...the fold-up capability of the M2 suits my needs...takes just a few minutes.  This is a LOT of trainer for the money.
review.name: Best value in it's class

review.reviewBody: I purchased my M2 in September of 2019. Overall, it has been a great trainer - good accuracy, good road feel, good simulation, and minimal footprint. I'm ~200lbs, have a 1000W sprint, and have put about 20,000 miles on my trainer in Zwift. After this usage (abuse?), a weld  attaching the resistance unit to the frame failed, but even with one bracket broken, the trainer kept working (with the calibration drifting)… I didn’t discover the issue until the second weld cracked and calibration wasn’t working. An email to support, and I had a replacement frame (lifetime warranty) in less than a week. Tough product and great warranty service.
review.name: Great trainer and warranty service

review.reviewBody: Have been using the M2 for about six months and have been extremely happy with it! Easy to set up and the clutch on the tire/roller knob gives the right amount of pressure every time, no worrying about slipping or excessive drag. I trainer for the track and routinely push 1500 watts on the M2 with no issues. Maybe not as quite as some trainers, but with the a fan blowing I don't really notice it. Great trainer, glad I got it!
review.name: Solid Smart Trainer and Great Value!

review.reviewBody:
The M2 is my latest Saris trainer.  Like the others it is rock solid.
1) easy set up and adjustment.  Also easy storage and transport.
2) While 'wheel off' models have advantages, those come at a price.  Having a solid investment background I do not think that most riders actually benefit from those advantages leaving us paying for features that do not yield us results.  High performance racers are excluded from this point.
3) the M2 is quiet enough to not awaken my light sleeper wife during my early morning training rides
4) Previous Saris trainers have held up for years in spite of me trying to wear them out during my frequent 3-5 hour sessions.  I expect this unit will as well.
review.name: Best All Round Option

review.reviewBody: Haven't had a turbo/trainer in 12+ years, have only been riding rollers when I have to. Last turbo I owned was a Saris Fluid 2, loved/hated that thing. It was an amazing tool to gain fitness. Finally decided to get a "smart" trainer, but not for Zwift or for virtual training, I purchased this so that I could control it with my Garmin head unit. I can do the Free Ride or build workouts in Garmin Connect. Took about two seconds to pair my Garmin and off I went. Too easy. If you want a virtual world virtual ride spend more for a virtual machine, but if you are looking to do traditional trainer workouts this is the perfect setup. I hate trainer workouts, but I am actually looking forward to using my new M2.
review.name: Quality, Simple, Easy to use

review.reviewBody: Holy moly! I wasn't ready for all the improvements in trainers since i bought my first one 20 years ago. This new tech has really changed what a  "oh, I spent 30 minutes on my trainer" means. It's a workout! And this is SO much quieter than my old one. I think a lot of us have a love/hate relationship with our trainer. This one has certainly upped the ante. Highly recommend upgrading from your old trainer.
review.name: A Lot Has Changed in 20 Years

review.reviewBody: I am comparing the m2 to a Wahoo Kickr Snap. The m2 is not as smooth of a ride as the snap. The Kickr Snap has more mass in the flywheel to help carry momentum. That being said the m2 works just fine. You need to download the Saris utility app for calibration. Also something else I have read from other reviews is to only turn the friction knob two full turns into the tire after the roller makes contact. I have had no problems with calibration doing this. No bent L bolt either. The m2 is not as quiet as the Kickr Snap, but it's not loud. Use a trainer tire to keep the noise at a minimum. Been using it for Zwift with no problems.
review.name: Not a bad smart trainer

review.reviewBody:
Very happy using with Zwift last season and am starting season 2.  A couple of issues...  First, the clutch in the tension knob simply does not work! However,  tightening until one can longer turn the wheel by polling on spokes I'd fine.  Second,  cadence is a bad joke!  Readings fluctuate +/- 15 or so RPM   constantly, and Zwift training lessons do not cclike that!  I got a separate sensor, and all is well!  OH YEAH,  the instructions tell one to create a Rouvy account to check  and upgrade firmware.  Why not tell the user to download the Saris app?  That  checks/upgrades firmware and calibrates the trainer.  It does NOT require a 3rd party account.  Also, if one does not want a network app, it let's one set the resistance as well
  STILL, very happy with this appliance!
review.name: Great, but...

name: M2 Smart Trainer

review.reviewBody: I purchased these shorts in black, size medium (like all of my shorts across all styles). I really like the overall appearance of the shorts, but the waist sizing is extremely tight- why not include a zipper fly at this price? I own the Astro Shorts - 7" in the same size and they aren't nearly as tight... Regardless, these aren't suitable for rock climbing, outdoor or indoor. First session I wore them on rock they snagged and frayed. I wore them again indoors and they got absolutely chewed up by the walls. Maybe these are more suitable for light hiking.
review.name: Tight waistband, fragile material

review.reviewBody: Found these at a thrift store with the tag still on, but they are now my favorite pair of shorts! The only ones I wore all summer. So comfortable and I love the pocket design, I can run and not worry about anything falling out. They are extremely breathable, great for sunny summer weather.
review.name: Love the Pocket Design

review.reviewBody: The most comfortable, good looking, easy shorts I've ever worn. I have so many of these now, and they're the only shorts in my closet. 11/10.
review.name: The best shorts I've ever come across

review.reviewBody: Light, quick drying, just enough stretch to remain durable, I'm okay without a fly, decent belt. I wear these for a week straight backpacking they are now my go to.
review.name: Movin Real Good

review.reviewBody: Better than baggies.. I know I know, but it's true !
review.name: The best?

review.reviewBody: I have been in the market for a new pair of shorts of a couple of years now. Until I tried the Ferris shorts from OR I really didn't know what I was missing! This is my first time using OR's Ferrosi fabric and I can tell that it is well made. I have used running shorts from Nike prior to these which are lighter weight but not nearly as durable. I love how OR includes two back pockets (please never change this!) It feels like a full robust pair of shorts with the five pockets you get and the 7" inseam is the perfect length. I started with a pair in black and plan to pick up another pair when more colors are released. I don't have a problem with the included belt, if you tuck in through the belt loop it stays out of the way and hasn't bothered me. I'm 5'7 and the size SMALL fits perfectly.
review.name: Best shorts ever!

review.reviewBody: Flattering. Stretchy. Fantastic color. Dry quickly. Zippered pockets make them great for canoeing. No notes.
review.name: Great color (great butt)

review.reviewBody: I love the Ferrosi material and the general fit of the shorts. However, the belt could be shortened a bit, as right now to fit my waist (I have a pair of 30in waist Ferrosi pants that fit pretty well) I have to pull the belt pretty far so a sizable amount dangles, and because the other end of the belt is fixed to the waistband, the belt sort of pinches the waistband fabric when I pull it tight enough to be more effective than the elastic of the waistband itself. Overall, a super minor complaint for some nice shorts.
review.name: Great shorts, belt could be improved

review.reviewBody: Great fit, highly durable and fantastic for paddling, hiking and biking.
review.name: I have these shorts in all available colors

review.reviewBody: I discovered ferrosi pants this winter and instantly fell in love with the comfort/stretch, durability, breathability and simultaneous wind resistance, even the fit is pretty good for my XL body. I had a good feeling the shorts would deliver the same experience, and I am pleased to find that they are just as great as the pants led me to believe they would be. Simple, effective belt. Ferrosi fabric, zippered leg pocket. Perfect shorts! Definitely going to be getting more colors for this summer.
review.name: New favorite shorts

review.reviewBody: I purchased these with some concerns from what I read in reviews about the difficulty to mount them tubeless. I mounted them to Zipp Firecrest 303s and it was easy. They went on the rims and “popped” on first try using an air canister. I’ve had no issues riding about 250 miles since mounting them. Smooth and quiet. Highly recommend these tires.
review.name: Good as advertised!

review.reviewBody: Works great in a 35c set up tubeless on Roval Terra CL's wheels.
review.name: Loving this tire set up tubeless

review.reviewBody:
Tubeless ready? Not even close!
New wheel, rim tape, valve. 40 ml Orange Seal, ridden 100 miles. Tire loses 20psi per hour.
Holding the wheel in water you can see air bubbles percolating out of the entire sidewall. This tire is not suitable for tubeless use.
review.name: Does not hold air. Total crap!

review.reviewBody: The only tire at this price point that is actually worth the money. The AS TR’s are the perfect balance of speed, weight, and durability.
review.name: The absolute best tire

review.reviewBody: I bought these for Idaho’s crappy roads. They are very stout, and setup tubeless extremes easy. They definitely aren’t light, but they road fast. I did an initial 35 mile ride on some horrible early season roads and didn’t have any issues and they gripped extremely well. Excited to see how long they last, but so far I am extremely pleased.
review.name: Great Tire for Bad Roads

name: Grand Prix 5000 AS TR Tire

review.itemreviewed: Merino 150 Tech Lite Natural Ski Tour T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a high quality garment that lives up to the price tag. It stays fresh even after a few wears and is perfect for travel. It does attract a lot of lint but the comfort and utility of this shirt outweighs that for me.
review.name: Thank you Sheep!

review.itemreviewed: Merino 150 Tech Lite Natural Ski Tour T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I buy this for my son- it's his favorite shirt. I buy one every year and it's his favorite gift. He wears it almost every day for work!
review.name: I would buy this product again and again and again!

review.itemreviewed: Merino 150 Tech Lite Natural Ski Tour T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love these shirts but sadly the consistency of the sizes was off, I received two smalls and one was significantly wider than the other. they also run long past the waist so I need to get them altered
review.name: Great shirt

review.itemreviewed: Merino 150 Tech Lite Natural Ski Tour T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This has been my go to shirt for everything from hanging out at home to walking, hiking and every kind of outdoor activity. A perfect blend of breathability, durability and warmth. Great value!
review.name: Perfect shirt for every activity

review.itemreviewed: Merino 150 Tech Lite Natural Ski Tour T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We bought these in men's & women's for a 3 week trekking adventure. These shirts are awesome. You can easily rinse to freshen up when you have access to running water, they dry quickly and don't hold any funky smell, perfect for travel. We took 2 for each of us, so that one could be rinsed/dried and the other worn. Excellent purchase & worth the price. Weight is heavy enough to wear like a regular T (vs undershirt) but light enough to keep you cool on warm days & dry quickly when washed. Highly recommend.
review.name: Best T

review.itemreviewed: Merino 150 Tech Lite Natural Ski Tour T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: I really like it. It's become a T-shirt I look forward to wearing so I'm back for more!
review.name: Nice shirt

review.itemreviewed: Merino 150 Tech Lite Natural Ski Tour T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Overall the shirt will do what you are buying it for. It's not a fashion shirt that you will wear in daily life to look good. It's a shirt you will take on long term travel or doing outdoor adventures and it fits and looks like that. I will say it doesn't look bad, I would wear it out in town while traveling, but if you're looking for something that you'll wear to look good in daily this ain't it.
review.name: It's what you're expecting

review.itemreviewed: Merino 150 Tech Lite Natural Ski Tour T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These shirts are ultra comfortable and can be worn as an undershirt or a T-shirt, sporting attractive graphics.
review.name: Nice T-shirt and/or undershirt

review.itemreviewed: Merino 150 Tech Lite Natural Ski Tour T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] They fit like a classic T-shirt, don't wrinkle, itch or stink.
review.name: Best everyday & workout shirts!

review.itemreviewed: Merino 150 Tech Lite Natural Ski Tour T-Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Really like the fit on me. A little itchy at first, but it gets better.
review.name: Love it....so far.

name: Merino 150 Tech Lite Natural Ski Tour T-Shirt - Men's

description: Buy the Halfdays Murphy One-Piece Ski Suit - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Murphy One-Piece Ski Suit - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Halfdays Murphy One-Piece Ski Suit - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I love this suit! It keeps me warm and doesn’t restrict my movement at all. It has so many great extras, like the phone leash and lens wipe, plus plenty of pockets.
review.name: Warm, cute, and comfortable

review.reviewBody: I am 5’1”, 108 lbs. I bought the XS Short. The quality of the suit is great but the crotch drops down so far it looked like I was wearing harem pants or sagging my pants. When I zipped up the front over my face it was too tight of a fit to fit over my balaclava. My sister in law who is 5’4” tried it on and it looked much better on her. The short isn’t for 5’1” folks. Ended up returning due to fit.
review.name: Drop crotch and issues with fit
comment: Hi there, thank you so much for submitting your review. We're so sorry to hear that the fit of the Murphy Ski Suit did not work out for you. Rest assured your feedback has been passed along to our teams so we can make improvements in the future!

review.reviewBody: LOVE my new suit. I was warm, comfortable and had tons of movement without feeling like I was held back by so many layers. Definitely would recommend.
review.name: Super comfortable and high performance.

review.reviewBody: I ended up returning the medium for the small. I am 5'3" 140 lbs with curve and an athletic build. I found the m to be big, and not exhibit as clean of lines or be as flattering as the small. I really do love the suit, and am excited to put it to the test. It is warm and the fabric feels technical and lux. I am disappointed there is not an easy way to use the bathroom outside of taking it off- versus a butt zipper like other snow suits or my current bibs, but was willing to keep it for the look and feel.
review.name: Nice suit

review.reviewBody: This suit is great!  It has pockets in all the right places and zippers to ventilate if you are getting hot!  They really thought about what you need when they designed this one piece suit!  Great price too!
review.name: One-piece suit for skiing is back again!

name: Murphy One-Piece Ski Suit - Women's

review.reviewBody: These Cranks are beautiful and work well but I just can't recommend something so absurdly priced.  $139 for a chain ring?!  The certer lock is annoying as you have to have the shimano specific tool.  Everyone has to do their own which is another consumer screwing but it works well and is the same tool as the center lock rotors.  At least the BB is a reasonable price.

review.reviewBody: I could not find a size for these cups anywhere, not even on the Assos website, but they looked like espresso cups (which I was hoping for), and that is exactly what they are! Volume filled to the very top is 120 ml (about 4 oz): perfect size for a doppio at 60 ml or even a triple. The cups are of excellent quality and packaged in a classy box perfect for gift giving to a cycling and espresso loving friend.
review.name: These are ESPRESSO cups!

review.reviewBody: I barely even notice this helmet is on my head, yet it is so durable and warm! I will never get another helmet other than the Grid. HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS FOR YOUR NOGGIN'!
review.name: EPIC For Touring

review.reviewBody: This helmet has served me great in some of the coldest weather. It has super safe technology and is a great fit for most people.
review.name: Good Fit with Safe Technology

review.reviewBody: I had the opposite experience as the reviewer below.  I purchased an Anon and a Smith helmet prior, both of which cause pain in the temple region. The moral of the story is to buy the helmet that fits your head. This thing fits my head like a glove!  Also, super light!  The price is steep, but you get what you pay for with the quality.
review.name: Great helmet!

review.reviewBody:
I was really stoked to get this and had been eyeing it for a while.  At the price point it should be flawless but unfortunately it's not.  Overall really disappointed that a $260 MSRP helmet doesn't meet the basic comfort test.  Giro really missed the mark on this one IMO.  Returned.

First the good: This is a top-of-the-line helmet from Giro with MIPS, which helps keep your noggin from rotating too much in a twisting collision.  The design looks super cool and the venting system is well designed and the top vent slider to open/close works well.  The Grid helmet fit my Giro Contact goggles perfectly with no obvious gap.  The Fidlock buckle is neat and seems to work pretty well single handed, although that wasn't really a selling point for me.  Giro claims this is a new "spherical" MIPS system, however I'm skeptical it's a real improvement as noted below.

Cons: The liner is too bulky and right out of the box, it bunches around the temples.  At first I thought that was just from shipping, but when I put it on, I quickly found that underneath those bunchy areas Giro had the brilliant idea of putting small plastic pieces that push right into your temples, which cause immediate discomfort and I had a minor headache within like 30 seconds of wearing this helmet (each time I stubbornly tried it on, thinking it would be different the next time but it wasn't).  I tried various configurations with the neck strap, pulling the liner down tighter, and I had my wife try it on to see if I'm crazy but she had the same experience.  I even bought a second one just to make sure.  This is a design flaw and I strongly recommend against this, at least from a comfort perspective.
review.name: Uncomfortable fit causes headaches

name: Grid Mips Helmet

The banding around the neck and armholes is heavier and the straight hem isn’t as flattering as the older LWSD4520 style. 
Soft and lightweight fabric is very Based on the photos I didn’t expect the armholes to be as large as they are. It’s also much closer to a racer back than previous versions were. Layering is a must.
